Log session starting at 20:05:26 on Thursday, 24 July 2025.
<228hp 264m 132mv>

<246hp 264m 132mv> 
l
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
     A wooden one-man canoe sits here.
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.

The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.

stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to

<264hp 274m 132mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Fortress Chapel
  A large room of the upper floor of Krilin Fortress has been set aside for
the worship of various deities of light.  The chapel is simply decorated,
with plain wooden pews and a few holy symbols decorating the walls.  At the
west end of the room, a wooden speaking stand has been erected.  To the
north, a large alcove has been built into the chapel wall.  A door in the
east wall leads out into the hallway.  

[Exits: north (east) down]
     A tall, circular table of finely polished wood stands in the alcove.
(White Aura) Ygring Starid, the earth priest of Jolinn, stands in the chapel.

<270hp 274m 132mv> 
l
The Fortress Chapel
  A large room of the upper floor of Krilin Fortress has been set aside for
the worship of various deities of light.  The chapel is simply decorated,
with plain wooden pews and a few holy symbols decorating the walls.  At the
west end of the room, a wooden speaking stand has been erected.  To the
north, a large alcove has been built into the chapel wall.  A door in the
east wall leads out into the hallway.  

[Exits: north (east) down]
     A tall, circular table of finely polished wood stands in the alcove.
(White Aura) Ygring Starid, the earth priest of Jolinn, stands in the chapel.

<270hp 274m 132mv> 
d
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<270hp 274m 131mv> 
n
Inside the Gates
  Past the wrought iron gates is a wide corridor with walls cut from solid
granite blocks, lit by mounted white globes.  The entry corridor is
surprisingly simple for such a vast and well-known establishment, as it
bears no notable ornamentation.  The School's foyer awaits to the north,
opening up from the corridor's enclosure into a vast chamber.  To the south
lies the School's entrance.  

[Exits: north south]
(!) (White Aura) An aging gate guard stands here, welcoming new arrivals.
Arafis Tindel tells you, 'If you have a moment, I could use your help.  Would you mind?'

<270hp 274m 130mv> 
n
The Foyer of the School of Heroes
  The School of Heroes begins with a grand foyer, complete with a vaulted
ceiling held aloft by great marble columns.  The room is spacious and airy,
with high, white marble walls and mounted, shining globes to provide light. 
Two great marble stairways sit back, just off center toward the room's north
side.  One ascends to an upper level of the School, and spirals about a
great glass pillar as it rises.  A well-made desk sits not far from the
foyer's entrance, giving the receptionist an opportunity to greet new
students.  The other descends to a lower level, and voices echo from its
depths.  Three halls open to the north, east, and west, leading to other
branches of the School.  The corridor to the south leads to the School's
iron gates.  

A large sign sits off to one side, offering directions to students.

[Exits: north east south west up down]
(?) A mossy-haired caladaran woman sits at the reception desk.

<270hp 274m 129mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Entrance to the Hall of Arms
  The Hall of Arms is named so because it is intended to introduce all
young adventurers to the tools of their trade: weapons and armor.  The
entrance to the Hall is patterned differently than the foyer to the west;
instead of marble columns, it has gilded plating which covers the ceiling
above.  The floor is patterned with polished tile, although instead of
depicting the sigil of the School itself, it is a stylized sword and shield.
The scent of heated copper and smoke is dimly present in the room,
suggesting a forge within a reasonable proximity.  The Hall branches out to
the north, east, and south.  

A tall sign directs students to the services within the Hall of Arms.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<270hp 274m 128mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Hero's Armory
  This branch of the Hall of Arms includes the same pale stone and gilded
ceiling as its northern counterpart.  The room itself uses furniture
sparingly, offering a bench along the western wall for students to sit.  A
counter lines the south wall, made of polished wood.  The walls and the
front of the counter are decorated with various examples of the School's
in-house wares, including copper mail, shields, and cloth or hide
stitchwork.  The armory is well-lit and well-maintained on all accounts.  To
the east lies another shop, while the entrance to the Hall of Arms lies to
the north.  

A sign sits upon the counter with additional instructions.

[Exits: north east]
A retired mercenary sits behind the counter, offering his wares.
Arslan Cuningsforth tells you, 'Hail, Veljik!  Welcome to the Hero's Armory.'
Arslan Cuningsforth tells you, 'I have a good stock of armor, and it's inexpensive to boot.'
Arslan Cuningsforth tells you, 'It helps to be well-armed, so be prepared!'

<270hp 274m 126mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Hall of Arms
  The Hall of Arms continues east and west through the School of Heroes. 
This wide, spacious hallway connects its entryway to its well-regarded bank
branch, known as the Traveler's Purse.  The pale, smooth stones and gilded
ceiling continue here, the tiled floor swept clear of debris.  A couch lines
the northern and southern walls, giving students and visitors a place to
rest while they explore.  They are flanked by some small but attractive
plants, resting in matching planters.  The room is well lit, which only
highlights a lonely, makeshift wooden service-stand.  

[Exits: east west]
(!) (Flaming) A brown nefortean scholar offers odd jobs from his rickety stand.
Ichiaj Chidak tells you, 'I've got jobs for adventurers!  Adventurers like you!  Interested?'

<270hp 274m 125mv> 
w
w
The Entrance to the Hall of Arms
  The Hall of Arms is named so because it is intended to introduce all
young adventurers to the tools of their trade: weapons and armor.  The
entrance to the Hall is patterned differently than the foyer to the west;
instead of marble columns, it has gilded plating which covers the ceiling
above.  The floor is patterned with polished tile, although instead of
depicting the sigil of the School itself, it is a stylized sword and shield.
The scent of heated copper and smoke is dimly present in the room,
suggesting a forge within a reasonable proximity.  The Hall branches out to
the north, east, and south.  

A tall sign directs students to the services within the Hall of Arms.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<270hp 274m 124mv> 
The Foyer of the School of Heroes
  The School of Heroes begins with a grand foyer, complete with a vaulted
ceiling held aloft by great marble columns.  The room is spacious and airy,
with high, white marble walls and mounted, shining globes to provide light. 
Two great marble stairways sit back, just off center toward the room's north
side.  One ascends to an upper level of the School, and spirals about a
great glass pillar as it rises.  A well-made desk sits not far from the
foyer's entrance, giving the receptionist an opportunity to greet new
students.  The other descends to a lower level, and voices echo from its
depths.  Three halls open to the north, east, and west, leading to other
branches of the School.  The corridor to the south leads to the School's
iron gates.  

A large sign sits off to one side, offering directions to students.

[Exits: north east south west up down]
(?) A mossy-haired caladaran woman sits at the reception desk.

<270hp 274m 123mv> 
u
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Spiral Stairway
  Just above the foyer to the School of Heroes is a spiraling stairwell
leading upward.  It follows a central glass pillar, whose translucent
interior offers a variety of frozen stone replicas of birds, insects, and
winged beasts.  At its core is a marvelous sculpture of a dragon, donated by
the Glallian School in Earendam.  There are no external walls, but rather, a
sturdy handrail which follows the stairs' outer edge.  The lights of the
foyer glitter below, and the marble columns parallel the rise of the
stairwell's interior pillar.  A three way junction awaits above, while the
foyer is below.  

[Exits: up down]
A brown srryn female stands silently on the wide stairs.
Issthali tells you, 'Watch yourself.  If I see you get rough.  I get rough.'
Issthali tells you, 'Upstairs.  Acolytes show your future.'
Issthali tells you, 'Listen well.  Learn about many fates.'

s
<270hp 274m 121mv> 
Inside the Gates
  Past the wrought iron gates is a wide corridor with walls cut from solid
granite blocks, lit by mounted white globes.  The entry corridor is
surprisingly simple for such a vast and well-known establishment, as it
bears no notable ornamentation.  The School's foyer awaits to the north,
opening up from the corridor's enclosure into a vast chamber.  To the south
lies the School's entrance.  

[Exits: north south]
(!) (White Aura) An aging gate guard stands here, welcoming new arrivals.

<270hp 274m 120mv> 
s
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<270hp 274m 119mv>

s
<270hp 274m 119mv> 
e
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
     The bones of a deceased animal are piled here.
     A pair of copper chainmail leggings is here.
     A wooden one-man canoe sits here.
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

<270hp 274m 118mv> 
Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Nistaru stands behind the desk, sneering at petitioners.

<270hp 274m 117mv> 
s
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]

e

Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center

The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the east is Center Square.  

[Exits: east south west]

e
<270hp 274m 115mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

n
<276hp 274m 132mv> 
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones

the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.

The Tipsy Swordmaster
  The Tipsy Swordmaster is a tavern frequented by the less wealthy
mercenary classes of Var Bandor.  Filled with thick smoke from tobacco
pipes, the large common room of the tavern is filled with the loud sounds of
drinking warriors.  Some scattered tables are filled with boisterous
warriors to the east and west, and the common area is to the south.  Through
some well-travelled doors, the street lies north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

campaigners - mainly footman and the occasional pikeman from Var Bandor's
standing guard.  The rest of the tavern lies off to the west and south.

A Large Table
  A low circular table fills most of this room, filled by a throng of rowdy
barbarians, gravitating here from all parts of the city.  Pitchers of beer
and mead sit all over the center of the table, as the barbarians roar as
they exchange stories.  Waitresses nervously pass toward this section of the
tavern, drawn by the shouts of the barbarians for more drink.  Some
scattered tables are north, while the main bar is to the west.

The Bar of the Tipsy Swordmaster
  This pine-walled room houses the bar of the Tipsy swordsman.  The high
oak bar blocks off the southwest corner of the room and the kitchen area. 
Stout wooden stools line the bar, filled with patrons come to sample the
Tipsy Swordmaster's famous mead.  A large painting on the south wall depicts
the famous Battle of Dantaron, a battle from the War of Endless Night.  The
common room is north, and a low roar of noise comes from the east.

The Common Room of the Tipsy Swordmaster
  The common room of the Tipsy Swordmaster is a riot of activity. 
Waitresses work their way through the crowd, stolidly ignoring the ogling of
the crowd of rowdy warriors.  The room is illuminated by cast iron lanterns,
which hang down from the ceiling on long chains, serving as a crude sort of
chandelier.  The inn stretches out in all directions, though more people
seem to be clustered about the bar to the south.

Fighting Pit

n
Aragol Street
  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north is a large warehouse, and to the south is a tavern.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<288hp 274m 123mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Open-Air Market
  A converted warehouse, this open-air market provides space for farmers
and traders to sell their perishable goods.  Crowds browse the stalls at all
hours, and the bustle never seems to die down completely.  Here, a stand
against the eastern wall displays s variety of fruits and vegetables.  From
ripe, red apples to odorous cabbage, the wares are carefully organized, with
the freshest exemplars of their kind given pride of place.  A wide aisle
between stalls leads north and west, and Aragol Street is to the south.  

[Exits: north south west]
Short and fat, an ethron greengrocer stands here.

  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center

[Exits: east west]

<288hp 274m 118mv> 
w
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the east is Center Square.  

[Exits: east south west]
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.

<288hp 274m 116mv> 
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<288hp 274m 115mv> 
n
Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Nistaru stands behind the desk, sneering at petitioners.

d
<288hp 274m 114mv> 
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<288hp 274m 113mv> 
s
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
     The bones of a deceased animal are piled here.
     A pair of copper chainmail leggings is here.
     A wooden one-man canoe sits here.
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

<288hp 274m 112mv> 
d
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Entrance to the Tower of Testing
  Just north of the Adventurer's Lounge lies a connecting junction between
it and the Tower of Testing.  This dimly lit vestibule is made of rougher
hewn stone than the smooth bricks of the School proper, giving it a more
ominous air.  A hanging oil lantern which dangles from the ceiling only
enhances this mood, its unsteady light filling the room with trembling
shadows.  Engraved into the stone floor is the iconic sigil of the School of
Heroes, which serves as this chamber's only real ornamentation.  To the
north, the Tower awaits, the many sounds of its beasts echoing off of the
ancient stone walls.

A standing sign offers information to students.

[Exits: north south]

<288hp 274m 111mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Beginning of the First Floor
  The Tower of Testing's first floor is a simple and rugged affair, built
of heavy, rough-hewn bricks.  Torches line the grey walls, and a chill
moisture clings to the air.  The floor underfoot is well-trod and packed
with rough mortar.  The first level of the Tower opens up into a low-lit,
open, and shadowy chamber.  There are no windows, and the dank air suggests
that this part is still below ground level.  The chamber continues to the
north, where the screeches of rats and the crackles of torches fill the
quiet air.  

A sign is affixed to an iron stand.

[Exits: north south]
An oversized rat sniffs and chews at some debris.

<288hp 274m 107mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Breezy Stairwell
  This stairwell is in the far northeast, just outside of the first floor
proper.  It is rugged and dark, lit with flickering torches.  However, as
the stairs climb higher, the chill cling of the air lessens and the basement
scent dims.  Warmer, fresher air travels downward on a faint breeze, causing
the flames to dance wildly atop their torches.  The steps are worn and
smooth, suggesting the passage of many feet.  To the south lies the
rat-infested first floor of the Tower of Testing, while the second floor
awaits above.  

[Exits: south up]

n

<288hp 274m 106mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Breezy Stairwell
  This stairwell is on the far north side of the second floor of the Tower
of Testing.  It is rugged and dark, lit with flickering torches.  As the
stairs descend back to the first level, the air becomes colder and more
dank.  Warmer, fresher air travels downward on a faint breeze, causing the
flames to dance wildly atop their torches.  The steps are worn and smooth,
suggesting the passage of many feet.  To the south lies the lizard habitat
on the second floor of the Tower of Testing, while the first floor lay
below.  

A standing sign describes the area to come.

<288hp 274m 105mv>

s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Beginning of the Second Floor
  The second floor of the Tower of Testing is at ground level, with high
windows bringing in light from the outside.  The floor is generally shaped
like a cross, with two long intersecting hallways.  The floor here is the
same rough-hewn stone as the level below, except it is now marked by lizard
droppings.  The scent of habitation is heavy in the air, but blissfully the
many windows offer a breeze and some freshening air.  The ceiling is fairly
high, and strung with oil lanterns.  This hallway continues south, while the
stairwell to the first floor lies to the north.  

[Exits: north south]
A large lizard flexes its forward legs and claws.

<288hp 274m 102mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Glass Stairwell
  The second floor comes to an end with a stairwell leading upward.  The
tower here begins a transition away from the rough-hewn stone of the lower
levels toward white brick and tile, much like that of the School of Heroes. 
The ceilings are substantially higher than the floor below, with high glass
panels that follow the stairs as they proceed further up.  From here you
have a pleasant but commanding view of Avendar's distant horizons, with
vents letting in further fresh air from above.  The stairway is
significantly warmer than below.  

[Exits: north up]

<288hp 274m 101mv> 
s
Alas, you cannot go that way.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Glass Stairwell
  The glass stairwell leads upward to the third floor of the Tower of
Testing.  The tower itself begins a transition away from the rough-hewn
stone of the lower levels toward white brick and tile, much like that of the
School of Heroes.  The ceilings are substantially higher than the floor
below, with high glass panels that follow the stairs as they proceed further
up.  From here you have a pleasant but commanding view of Avendar's distant
horizons, with vents letting in further fresh air from above.  The stairway
gets colder as it descends.  

A standing sign describes the trials of this floor.

<288hp 274m 100mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Beginning of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  To the south, a glass-enclosed stairwell descends to the
second floor, while the current one continues to the north.  

[Exits: north south]
An emerald green imp leans its head back, letting out a shrill, angry chirp.
An emerald green imp sees you and attacks!
You dodge an emerald green imp's attack.
An emerald green imp is in excellent condition.

<275hp 284m 137mv> 
l
A Corner on the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  The hall turns here, its two exits to the east and south.

[Exits: east south]
     The mutilated heart of an emerald green imp is lying here.
     A bowl of hot, watery gruel sits here.

The End of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  To the south, a marble stairwell ascends to the fourth
floor, while the hall continues to the north.

<245hp 290m 138mv>

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Marble Stairwell
  A marble stairwell leads upward to the fourth floor of the Tower of
Testing.  The white stones of the third level end at the entrance to this
stairwell, instead replaced by the iconic marble of the School's main level.
The tile floor looks less worn and of a higher sheen, and the stairwell
itself is polished to a high gloss.  Arched windows look out onto the world
at large, high enough to give the faint of heart a bit of pause.  The sounds
of battle ring out from the floor above.  The long hall of the third floor
lies to the north.  

[Exits: north up]

<245hp 290m 137mv> 
wear bracelet
You wear a pearl and diamond bracelet around your right wrist.

u
<245hp 290m 137mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Marble Stairwell
  A marble stairwell ends at the doorstep of the fourth floor of the Tower
of Testing.  This entire floor is done in the polished black tile of the
School of Heroes proper, and the walls are a high, glossy marble.  The
chamber which composes the fourth floor is the largest and most open yet,
the great expanse of its floor composing a patterned relief of the School's
iconic sigil.  The air is cool but smelling of exertion, blood, and metal. 
Lanterns hang from the ceiling to illuminate the final steps before entering
the floor.  Down the stairs, the third floor awaits.  

A plaque is inset into the wall at the top of the stairs.

[Exits: east down]

<245hp 290m 136mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Southwest Corner of the Fourth Floor
  This floor of the Tower of Testing is done in polished black tile, with
walls of high marble.  The ceiling is vaulted and extravagant, the entire
expanse forming a wide open battle arena.  The tiles of the floor compose a
patterned relief of the iconic sigil of the School of Heroes.  The air is
cool but smells of exertion, blood, and spellcraft.  Lanterns hang from the
high ceiling, lighting the chamber at night, while natural light filters in
through arched windows during the day.  A stairwell leads down to the third
floor to the west, while the chamber continues north and east.  

[Exits: north east west]

<149hp 300m 144mv>

The Northeast Corner of the Fourth Floor
  This floor of the Tower of Testing is done in polished black tile, with
walls of high marble.  The ceiling is vaulted and extravagant, the entire
expanse forming a wide open battle arena.  The tiles of the floor compose a
patterned relief of the iconic sigil of the School of Heroes.  The air is
cool but smells of exertion, blood, and spellcraft.  Lanterns hang from the
high ceiling, lighting the chamber at night, while natural light filters in
through arched windows during the day.  The floor continues to the west and
south, while a stairwell to the east leads up to the fifth level.  

[Exits: east south west]

You get 2 copper coins from the corpse of Daloeq.
You get 2 silver coins from the corpse of Daloeq.

<112hp 300m 144mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Stone Stairwell
  A stone stairwell leads upward toward the fifth floor, just on the other
side of the large tiled arena of the fourth.  The arched windows and heavy
construction suggest that this is one of the oldest remaining parts of the
Tower of Testing, the stone worn smooth by a thousand years of young
adventurers.  The stairs are smooth and even, and worn in the center from
the crossing of many footsteps.  Torches light the stairwell, giving it the
same shadowy cast as some of the lowest floors of the School and Tower.  The
fifth floor awaits above, while the tests of battle are to the west.  

[Exits: west up]

A Stone Stairwell
  A stone stairwell exits onto the fifth floor, at the end of a stone
corridor.  The arched windows and heavy construction suggest that this is
one of the oldest remaining parts of the Tower of Testing, the stone worn
smooth by a thousand years of young adventurers.  The stairs are smooth and
even, and worn in the center from the crossing of many footsteps.  Torches
light the stairwell, giving it the same shadowy cast as some of the lowest
floors of the School and Tower.  The fifth floor continues to the south,
while the stairs lead back to the fourth floor below.  

A tall sign stands near the top of the stairwell.

The Fifth Floor
  The fifth floor is among the oldest parts of the Tower of Testing, built
of heavy, rough-hewn stone.  The arched windows and smooth, worn stone
suggest the passage of untold adventurers over many generations, the floor
clear of debris and signs of disrepair.  Old stains of blood mark the stone
walls, and heavy iron lanterns hang from the ceiling to light the corridor. 
A large door leads to the south, its frame secure and marked with runic
wards.  The stairwell lies to the north, while this level of the Tower
awaits behind the southern door.

<203hp 306m 168mv> 
l
The Fifth Floor
  The fifth floor is among the oldest parts of the Tower of Testing, built
of heavy, rough-hewn stone.  The arched windows and smooth, worn stone
suggest the passage of untold adventurers over many generations, the floor
clear of debris and signs of disrepair.  Old stains of blood mark the stone
walls, and heavy iron lanterns hang from the ceiling to light the corridor. 
A large door leads to the south, its frame secure and marked with runic
wards.  The stairwell lies to the north, while this level of the Tower
awaits behind the southern door.  

[Exits: north (south)]
     This copper sword seems a sturdy weapon for a young adventurer.
     A pair of copper chainmail leggings is here.
     This copper javelin seems a sturdy weapon for a young adventurer.
The stone guardian stands here in mute silence.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Fifth Floor
  The fifth floor is among the oldest parts of the Tower of Testing, built
of heavy, rough-hewn stone.  The arched windows and smooth, worn stone
suggest the passage of untold adventurers over many generations, the floor
clear of debris and signs of disrepair.  Old stains of blood mark the stone
walls, and heavy iron lanterns hang from the ceiling to light the corridor. 
A long slit in the eastern wall glitters with sharp points, a mounted
barrage of daggers waiting for the unwary.  A large door leads to the north,
its frame secure and marked with runic wards.  The fifth level continues
through a shimmering portal set into the south wall.  

[Exits: north south]

<203hp 306m 167mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Small Granite Chamber
  This stone chamber is built from smooth blocks of pale granite, four
bracketed torches ensconced on each wall.  The ceiling is high and largely
oddly disorienting, as the floor and walls are all the same color and
texture.  The air is cool and crisp, tinged with a hint of magical energy. 
There are no apparent exits in any direction, making the low ceiling seem
even more claustrophobic.  

[Exits: none]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth turns its attention to you.
The magic mouth grins widely.
The magic mouth says, 'The more places I be, the less you can see.'
The magic mouth asks, 'What am I?'

<203hp 306m 166mv> 
say Darkness
You say, 'Darkness'
The magic mouth opens widely, and you are pulled suddenly through!
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Lavish Enclosure
  On the other side of the magic mouth's portal is a lavishly decorated
chamber, which appears to be the highest level of the Tower of Testing.  The
walls largely absent, the high roof held aloft by mighty stone columns.  A
barrier of energy surrounds the enclosure, allowing the passing breeze and
cool air of the Tower's great height.  The marble floor is covered in a
rich, burgundy carpet, with gold-mounted orbs of light illuminating the
room.  The view outside is little more than a cloudscape, with the sun and
moons clearly visible to occupants.  The chamber continues to the south.  

[Exits: south]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.

<209hp 321m 176mv>

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Lavish Enclosure
  Before you is a lavishly decorated chamber, which appears to be the
highest level of the Tower of Testing.  The walls largely absent, the high
roof held aloft by mighty stone columns.  A barrier of energy surrounds the
enclosure, allowing the passing breeze and cool air of the Tower's great
height.  The marble floor is covered in a rich, burgundy carpet, with
gold-mounted orbs of light illuminating the room.  The view outside is
little more than a cloudscape, with the sun and moons clearly visible to
occupants.  A well-polished desk sits within the enclosure, a large array of
scrolls, books, and other materials piled at either side.  A golden spiral
staircase heads up onto the roof itself, while the chamber continues to the
north.  

[Exits: north up]
A dark-skinned human monk sits at a desk, recording the names of young heroes.
Yagrin the scribe tells you, 'Congratulations, Veljik.  You have safely ascended the Tower of
Testing.'
Yagrin the scribe tells you, 'All that remains is to go up those stairs and receive the Sigil of the
School of Heroes.'
Yagrin the scribe adds your name to the scrolls of heroes.
Your standing with the School of Heroes improves!

<209hp 321m 175mv> 
u
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Roof of the Tower of Testing
  The high roof of the Tower is shielded by a barely perceptible field of
magic, but otherwise is entirely unencumbered.  It includes a large central
platform, upon which six slender spires rise, matching a convex hexagon's
points.  The golden staircase from below arrives between two of such spires,
allowing admission to the platform.  The glittering stone of the rooftop
shines in both sunlight and moonlight, and the shrill wind whips between the
spires.  The surrounding skyscape is above the clouds, their wispy expanse
making the roof seem more like an island in a white sea.  A large orb sits
at the center of the platform, beckoning you.  The only apparent exit is
down the golden stairs.  

[Exits: down]
A marble statue of a scholar stands silently beside the central orb.
The marble scholar brands you with the Sigil of the School of Heroes.
Obtain the School Sigil is complete!
Return to Jimacha in The School of Heroes to collect your reward.

The Roof of the Tower of Testing
  The high roof of the Tower is shielded by a barely perceptible field of
magic, but otherwise is entirely unencumbered.  It includes a large central
platform, upon which six slender spires rise, matching a convex hexagon's
points.  The golden staircase from below arrives between two of such spires,

<209hp 321m 174mv> 
l orb
This large orb crackles with mystic energy.  As you look at it, you can
see the image of a small office within its depths.  Something about it
beckons you to touch it.  

<209hp 321m 174mv> 
touch orb
You touch the orb, and you feel yourself drawn into its image.
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Small Delivery Office
  This small office is walled with the same white-stone blocks as are used
in the Hall of Arms and lined with similar iron sconces.  It is decorated
with hanging burgundy tapestries, giving it a richer, more mercantile feel. 
A small wooden desk and chair sit against the western wall, bearing a tiny
inkwell and quill-stand.  The ceiling is low and plain, the light from the
sconces playing across its uneven surface.  Open doorways lead out of the
office to the north and south, with the northern portal shimmering with
magical energy.  

[Exits: north]
(!) A pudgy nefortean merchant peruses a long scroll at his desk.
Eliaj Onat tells you, 'Veljik, Veljik, Veljik!'
Eliaj Onat tells you, 'I have a package for one of your teachers.'
Eliaj Onat tells you, 'Will you deliver it??'

with hanging burgundy tapestries, giving it a richer, more mercantile feel. 
A small wooden desk and chair sit against the western wall, bearing a tiny
inkwell and quill-stand.  The ceiling is low and plain, the light from the
sconces playing across its uneven surface.  Open doorways lead out of the
office to the north and south, with the northern portal shimmering with
magical energy.  

[Exits: north]
(?) A pudgy nefortean merchant peruses a long scroll at his desk.

<209hp 321m 174mv> 
n
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<209hp 321m 173mv> 
n
Inside the Gates
  Past the wrought iron gates is a wide corridor with walls cut from solid
granite blocks, lit by mounted white globes.  The entry corridor is
surprisingly simple for such a vast and well-known establishment, as it
bears no notable ornamentation.  The School's foyer awaits to the north,
opening up from the corridor's enclosure into a vast chamber.  To the south
lies the School's entrance.  

[Exits: north south]
(!) (White Aura) An aging gate guard stands here, welcoming new arrivals.

<209hp 321m 172mv> 
s
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<209hp 321m 171mv> 
s
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
     The bones of a deceased animal are piled here.
     A pair of copper chainmail leggings is here.
     A wooden one-man canoe sits here.
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

<209hp 321m 170mv> 
e
Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Nistaru stands behind the desk, sneering at petitioners.

<209hp 321m 169mv> 
s
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.

e
<215hp 322m 175mv> 
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the east is Center Square.  

[Exits: east south west]

e
<215hp 322m 174mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<215hp 322m 173mv> 
n
n
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.

<215hp 322m 170mv> 
e
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.  

[Exits: north east south west]

e
e
<215hp 322m 169mv> 
e
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<215hp 322m 168mv> 
s
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A small group of men
to the south mill around the mercenary's guild, while a small house lies
north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<215hp 322m 167mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  Raddin Street
deadends at a stone wall to the east, and returns to the west.  North is a
run-down flophouse, and a large tavern to the south is decorated with a sign
proclaiming it to be the Tipsy Swordmaster.  

[Exits: (north) east south west]
A battered and scarred gladiator guards the entrance to the tavern.

<215hp 322m 166mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Wench's Lute
  This shop lies just off of the east end of Raddin Street, and is exactly
as dingy as one might expect for the surroundings.  One of the windows is
boarded over, and the other is made of bubbled, foggy glass.  An imitation
Harrudim rug covers most of the uneven floor, and a roughly made counter is
toward the east side of the room.  Instruments are mounted on the walls
along with dim lights, providing examples of the shop's wares.  A wooden
doorway leads west.  

[Exits: west]
An unsavory human woman tends the counter.

<215hp 322m 165mv> 
Alas, you cannot go that way.

<215hp 322m 164mv> 
s
The Tipsy Swordmaster
  The Tipsy Swordmaster is a tavern frequented by the less wealthy
mercenary classes of Var Bandor.  Filled with thick smoke from tobacco
pipes, the large common room of the tavern is filled with the loud sounds of
drinking warriors.  Some scattered tables are filled with boisterous
warriors to the east and west, and the common area is to the south.  Through
some well-travelled doors, the street lies north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<215hp 322m 163mv> 
w
A Quiet Corner
  While filled with the same tables as other parts of the bar, this corner
seems a little quieter.  A small wooden stage rises up on the west wall for
entertainers, but it shows signs of disuse.  The entrance to the bar is
east, while some scattered tables are south.  

[Exits: east south]
(Targeted) Swordmaster Mengjaal rests on a chair in the corner, aloof from the rowdiness.

l paper
Directions to the Tipsy Swordmaster:
====================================
1. From the golden fountain, head south to the Chamber of Travel.
2. The portal to the east will take you to Var Bandor.
3. From the temple, head south once.
4. Head east until you see the fountain in Center Square.
5. Follow Sadrent Road north.  Pay attention to the cross streets.
6. When Sadrent intersects with Raddin Street, take Raddin Street
   east until it dead-ends.
7. The Tipsy Swordmaster lies to the south.  Enter, and find Master
   Mengjaal.  Give him the package!

<227hp 322m 171mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Iron Street
  Iron street is in a working class part of Var Bandor, and is far from
being one of the nicer areas in the city.  Men walk about along the street
going about their business, and few seem to notice you here.  Some small,
cramped houses line the streets between the larger warehouses, and some
children wearing ragged clothes can be seen playing outdoors.  The people
here do not seem as happy as those in the nicer parts of the city--a faint
air of oppression hangs over the working class folk of Iron Street.  To the
east is Sadrent Road.  

[Exits: east (south) west]

rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.

<227hp 322m 163mv> 
e
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the east is Center Square.  

[Exits: east south west]

e
<227hp 322m 162mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

s
s
<227hp 322m 161mv> 
s
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.  

[Exits: north south]
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.

<227hp 322m 154mv>

The Bank of Var Bandor
  The most noticeable feature in the Bank is the line of teller windows
along the far wall.  The keen eyes of bankers peer out from behind the
barred windows, scrutinizing their clientele.  Plants and small wooden
benches provide the decor for those waiting for service, and a doorway leads
southwards onto Commerce Street.

<227hp 322m 150mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of
the fire.  Shirts made of fine steel, leggings, sleeves, and assorted mails
of all type are all on display hanging from the walls.  Besides the forge
near the back of the store, the rest of the building looks immaculately
clean giving a sense of regality not normally associated with a smithy-type
shop.  You can exit back to the west.  

[Exits: west]
The armorer shows off his wares.

<227hp 322m 147mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gleaming Blade
  Torches adorn both side walls and sit upright in their gilded holders. 
Their light flickers and causes the various bladed weapons to glint sharply.
Several studded maces, and various other weapons of destruction are lined
along the walls in weapon racks.  A spinning stone wheel, used for
sharpening blades, stands near the back of the shop with a bucket of water
next to it to help with the enormous amount of heat produced during the
process.  You can exit back to the west.

Avoid phrases that make references to real-life things (e.g. "pardon my French"), but you do not 
need to use archaic or strange speech, talk around basic setting concepts, or avoid swearing if that 
is what your character would do.

Center Square

made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

e
Aragol Street
  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the west is Center Square.

s
<239hp 322m 152mv> 
A Broad Side Street
  Leading south of Aragol Street, a broad side road leads between two
warehouses of Var Bandor.  The street is paved with granite blocks, and is
surprisingly well-maintained.  To the west rises the windowless limestone
facade of Var Bandor's prison, while to the east the a wide staircase leads
up to the Office of City Planning.

  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north is a large warehouse, and to the south is a tavern.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<239hp 322m 149mv>

Aragol Street
  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the west is Center Square.  

[Exits: east west]
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.

w
<239hp 322m 148mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.

s
<239hp 322m 145mv> 
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.  

[Exits: north (east) south]
The innkeeper bustles around the room, a warm welcoming smile on his round face.
A woman sits here, enjoying the peace of the inn.
A patron of the inn sits here, enjoying a fine meal.
A young boy sits here, spinning a brightly coloured top.

<239hp 322m 144mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
In the Tables
  The tables are scattered around the room in what seems to be a random
fashion, but there is still ample space for the barmaids to walk through to
set out food and drinks.  A large fireplace dominates the south wall, the
hearth is swept and ready for a warm fire during the winter.  A small
staircase leads upwards in the south-west corner of the room, to the
comfortable beds waiting for a weary customer to rest upon.  East are the
swinging doors leading to the kitchen, and north lies the entrance to the
inn.  

[Exits: north east up]
     A simple chessboard sits on a plain wooden table against the western wall.
Leaning back in his chair, a man enjoys a meaty chicken leg.
A haggard-looking man drowns his sorrows in a bottle of whisky.
A priestess of Alajial sits quietly nearly the fireplace.
A mother stands here, looking around for her son.

<239hp 322m 143mv> 
l aldred
This young man sits alone, gazing morosely at the empty tumblers which
litter the table's surface.  It seems that some time ago he chose to forego
the more civilized intermediary of the glass, and now drinks directly from
the whisky bottle.  He wears the fine clothing of a successful merchant,
although looks (and smells) as though he hasn't changed them in days.  
Aldred is in excellent condition.

<258hp 322m 164mv> 
    map basics (quick start guide)
    ----------------------------------------

    Mudlet Mapper works in tandem with a script, and this generic mapper script needs
    to know 2 things to work:
      - room name  (In the Tables)
      - exits      (up east north)

    1. start mapping <optional area name>
       If both room name and exits are good, you can start mapping! Give it the
       area name you're currently in, usually optional but required for the first one.
    2. find prompt
       Room name or exits aren't recognised? Try this command then. It will make
       the script start looking for a prompt using several standard prompt
       patterns. If a prompt is found, you will be notified, if not, you will
       need to set a prompt pattern yourself using map prompt.
       Reach out to the Mudlet community for help, we'd be happy to help
       you figure it out!
    3. map debug
       This toggles debug mode. When on, messages will be displayed showing what
       information is captured and a few additional error messages that can help
       with getting the script fully compatible with your game.
    4. map help
       This will bring up a more detailed help file, starting with the available
       help topics.

<289hp 322m 162mv> 
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.  

[Exits: north south]
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.

sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the west is the guild of watchers, while Naidji Alley lies to
the east.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is

<289hp 322m 153mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.

<289hp 322m 151mv> 
s
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Inside the Southern Gatehouse
  The southern gatehouse of Var Bandor is an elaborate affair,
well-maintained and proper.  A close watch is kept on the kind of traveler
allowed to enter the finest districts of the city, and a roster of those
banned from the area is kept nearby.  The immense granite walls rise to
either side of the gates, and to the south, the outskirts of Var Bandor run
into a thickly wooded area.  North, Ilrin Street leads into the heart of the
city.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

  Surrounded by newly constructed buildings, Commerce Street winds through
the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,

clothing of the citizens, and the meticulous maintenance of the streets.  To

<299hp 322m 152mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Auction House
  This chamber is profusely decorated with expensive artwork and antique
furniture, much of it discreetly labeled with extortionate prices.  Several
rows of bench seating dominate the room, facing a podium set atop a small
stage.  The room is brilliantly lit, allowing excellent views of the
merchandise for sale here, and seals of Merchant Council licensing are
prominently displayed.  A sign sits atop a table on the side, detailing how
proceedings occur here.  A grand double-doorway opens southwards onto
Commerce Street.  

[Exits: south]
A well-dressed auctioneer is here, examining a list of goods.
The Grand Auctioneer tells you, 'Welcome, Veljik. We hold auctions here daily. You may look at the
sign for further details.'
The Grand Auctioneer nods to the sign.

The Cartographer
  From wall to wall, bins are filled with rolled-up pieces of parchment
making up a collection of drawings of the world, a few times over.  On a
desk, near the back of the room, an inkpot, several quills, and lots of
unfinished maps rest atop a workdesk.  A letter is on top of the counter
addressed to the Wanderers of Avendar, that is likely how this Cartographer
gets his information, however, the price is probably not a cheap one. 
Commerce Street lies to the east.

The Gem Store

gems to be of high-quality.  Nothing else is considered worth buying in the

The General Outfitter
  This is where the upper class comes to buy the more general things needed
to exist.  From candles to boxes, the shop has everything that an individual
might need to live a productive life.  Several potted plants of various
sizes sit against the side walls and a few pieces of semi-tasteful art hang
from the wall.  You can head back out onto Commerce Street to the east.

Fine Provisions
  A fine establishment catering to the upper class of adventurers provides
food to those who can afford to furnish their expeditions with the best, as
well as those who simply need to fill their packs with hardbread.  Shelves
lined with containers of food crowd the walls of the store, and in a back
room piles of crates are visible.

prohibited.  A golden plaque is set near the gilded door of a nearby
building.  

[Exits: north south (west)]

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the

prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.

<214hp 222m 156mv> 
whe
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<214hp 222m 155mv> 
n
n
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

Dretch Street
  The dingy cobbled street is narrow and flanked by looming tenements or
ancient houses, many hollowed out by flame or disrepair.  Spherical
magelights shine day and night atop tall iron poles, illuminating the
perpetual muck that accumulates on the road.  The smell of baking bread
drifts out of the building to the south.  

[Exits: east south west]

<214hp 222m 143mv> 
n
Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

<214hp 222m 140mv> 
A Ferry Station
  The waters of the Dantaron River flow placidly to the north, a muddy
brown barrier to merchants, carts, and foot travelers.  A small wooden dock
has been erected at the water's edge, and several large ferries run by
riverfolk carry passengers back and forth between the Arien Road and the
outskirts of Var Bandor.

[Exits: north south]
A child of Var Bandor runs along playfully, giggling and laughing.
The ferryman stands along the river, offering to transport travelers.

<231hp 238m 141mv> 
help weather
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          AREAS COMMANDS WORTH TIME                                        |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Syntax: areas Syntax: commands Syntax: score Syntax: time Syntax: weather
Syntax: time system

AREAS shows you a list of areas in the game, including suggested level ranges
for each.

COMMANDS shows you all the commands in the game.

TIME shows the Avendarian time.

TIME SYSTEM shows the system time, as well as when the mud last started,
and the current local time for the host computer.

WEATHER shows the current game weather.

The WORTH command will bring up a quick spread of useful information,
detailing such things as the amount of gold you have, how much xp/ep
needed to reach the next level, and the number of arrows in your
possession.  Spellcasters should note that when they are encumbered,
they will be able to see it through the worth command.

<231hp 238m 141mv> 
help time
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          AREAS COMMANDS WORTH TIME                                        |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Syntax: areas Syntax: commands Syntax: score Syntax: time Syntax: weather
Syntax: time system

AREAS shows you a list of areas in the game, including suggested level ranges
for each.

COMMANDS shows you all the commands in the game.

TIME shows the Avendarian time.

TIME SYSTEM shows the system time, as well as when the mud last started,
and the current local time for the host computer.

WEATHER shows the current game weather.

The WORTH command will bring up a quick spread of useful information,
detailing such things as the amount of gold you have, how much xp/ep
needed to reach the next level, and the number of arrows in your
possession.  Spellcasters should note that when they are encumbered,
they will be able to see it through the worth command.

<239hp 238m 145mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The North Gates of Earendam
  Earendam's north gates are forged from black iron, built between the
stone walls of the city.  Reinforced by stout iron bars, the gates are built
thick, for increased security.  Outside the gates lie the expanse of the
northern grasslands, across which runs the Earendam road, which leads all
the way to the Brintors.  Inside, Tyril Square marks the beginning of
Earendam proper.  

[Exits: north south]
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.
