<239hp 238m 144mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
North of Tyril Square
  The north part of Tyril square lies very near the gates of Earendam,
which lie to the north.  Past the gates are grasslands, and eventually the
Brintor mountains, which provide most of the source of Earendam's mineral
wealth and its building materials.  The gate is mainly used by Brintorean
miners, traders, or the occasionally diplomatic party from Kor Thrandir. 
East and west, the corners of the square end in arched buildings, while a
central fountain dominates the square to the south.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<239hp 238m 143mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Northwest of Tyril Square
  The northwest corner of Tyril Square is formed by the intersection of
Earendam's massive north wall and a squat brownstone building to the west. 
Covered with a cobblestone of glazed brown bricks, the square stretches off
south and east, heading toward the north gates of town to the east, and a
central fountain to the southeast.  The occasional armed patrol lingers
around an arched portcullis to the west, usually coming from or going to the
north gates of the town.  Further south the square opens to the west,
following Frinian Way.  

[Exits: east south west]

<239hp 238m 142mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Entrance to the Company of the Jackal
  The entrance to the Company of the Jackal's headquarters is a dingy
place, ill-tended by the templars who use this compound.  Dusty stones line
the walls, and rusty portcullises leave the chamber in all directions save
north.  A cracked tablet is affixed by the square doorway to the north,
which leads inside the headquarters.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A templar swordsman slouches against the doorway.

<239hp 238m 141mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Frinian Way
  Frinian Way is a broad but winding street which bends west and south as
it makes its way through New Earendam.  Scholars, artisans and other
craftsmen use this street, bringing their goods from the east part of the
city to service the mercantile activity in the Arien Plaza.  The street runs
flush with the northern wall of Earendam, which towers well over 
twelve feet in height.  Made from bricks shaped by earth scholars, the wall
is well maintained, and almost clashes with the much older and more scuffed
cobblestones of Frinian.  To the east of here, a gated archway leads toward
the headquarters of the Company of the Jackal, one of the groups of
chartered templars which patrol the area north of Earendam proper.  

[Exits: east south west]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.

<239hp 238m 140mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Frinian Way
  Frinian Way is a broad but winding street which bends north and west as
it makes its way through New Earendam.  Scholars, artisans and other
craftsmen use this street, bringing their goods from the east part of the
city to service the mercantile activity in the Arien Plaza.  The street runs
flush with the northern wall of Earendam, which towers well over twelve feet
in height.  Made from bricks shaped by earth scholars, the wall is well
maintained, and almost clashes with the much older and more scuffed
cobblestones of Frinian.  

[Exits: east south]

<239hp 238m 139mv> 
w
Alas, you cannot go that way.

<239hp 238m 139mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Frinian Way
  Frinian Way is a broad but winding street which bends north and west as
it makes its way through New Earendam.  Scholars, artisans, and other
craftsmen use this street, bringing their goods from the east to the Arien
Plaza, where they can be peddled to the merchants that gather there further
west.  The buildings lining this street appear of more recent construction
than the cobblestones of Frinian, which show the marks of what could only be
nigh on hundreds of years of wear.  In contrast, the surrounding buildings,
while hewn from the Brintors, show signs of the shapings of magic.  In
particular, a small tower and base lies to the northwest of here, seemingly
formed from the melting of some liquid black stone.  Home to the enigmatic
Brotherhood of the Golden Flame, the tower seems active, but no entrance is
apparent from this vantage point.  

[Exits: north west]

w
<239hp 238m 138mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Frinian Way
  Frinian Way is a broad but winding street which bends east and south as
it makes its way through New Earendam.  Scholars, artisans and other
craftsmen use this street, bringing their goods from the east part of the
city to service the mercantile activity in the Arien Plaza.  The buildings
lining this street appear of more recent construction than the cobblestones
of Frinian, which shows the marks of what could only be nigh on hundreds of
years of wear.  In contrast, the surrounding buildings, while hewn from the
Brintors, show signs of the shapings of magic.  Most dramatic is a small
tower and base, which lies to both the north and west.  The entire buildings
appears to have been formed from the melting of some liquid black stone, the
tower is also known to be home to the enigmatic Brotherhood of the Golden
Flame.  A small trickle of traffic comes to and from the base of the tower,
which can be accessed via an opening in the stone to the west.  

[Exits: east south west]

<239hp 238m 137mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Entrance to the Tower of the Golden Flame
  The entrance to the tower of the Brotherhood of the Golden Flame is a
cramped and hot antechamber, illuminated by glowing bowls of pitch.  Gold
engravings glow red in the flickering light, covering the walls and doorway
in a series of eerie patterns.  Otherwise, the room seems to be made of a
blackish stone, which seems to have been melted into place as a solid lump
to form the ceiling and floor.  A small break in the wall leads out of the
tower to the east, and an archway leads into the interior of the tower to
the north.  

[Exits: north east]
Clad in crimson robes, a Brother of the Golden Flame stands alert.

A Bend in Frinian Way
  Frinian Way is a broad but winding street which bends north and west as
it makes its way through New Earendam.  Scholars, artisans, and other
craftsmen use this street, bringing their goods from the east to the Arien

Frinian Way
  Frinian Way is a broad but winding street which heads generally east and
west through New Earendam.  Scholars, artisans, and other craftsmen use this
street, bringing their goods from the east to the Arien Plaza, where they
can be peddled to the merchants that gather there.  The buildings lining
this street appear of more recent construction than the cobblestones of
Frinian, which show the marks of what could only be nigh on hundreds of
years of wear.  In contrast, the surrounding buildings, while hewn from the
Brintors, show signs of the shapings of magic.  In particular, a small tower
and base lies to the north of here, seemingly formed from the melting of
some liquid black stone.  Home to the enigmatic Brotherhood of the Golden
Flame, the tower seems active, but no entrance is apparent from this side of
the street.  

[Exits: east west]

w
<245hp 238m 153mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Eastern Arien Plaza
  The Arien plaza comes to an end here, narrowing to Frinian Way, which
winds eastward into the part of the city known as New Earendam.  The
merchants who mill about the other parts of the plaza thin here, and the
travelers heading east here tend to be artisans or scholars of one form or
the other.  Shops line the sides of the plaza further north and south, and a
fountain dominates the center of the plaza to the west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<245hp 238m 152mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Northeastern Arien Plaza
  The northeastern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as
merchants and travelers pass through the area, heading to and from the west
gate of the city, which lies southwest.  The open expanse of the plaza
gradually comes to an end here, eventually terminating in a series of shops
to the north, and the wall of a tall building to the east.  Most prominent
among the shops to the north is a supply house of some sort, from which
merchants trickle in and out, gathering supplies for their journeys along
the Arien.  

[Exits: north south west]
A merchant's bodyguard scans the crowd, watchful of his charge.
A merchant of Earendam mills about the plaza.

<245hp 238m 151mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Kantilus's General Store
  An older building of stone, Kantilus's shop provides for the needs of
travelers who pass to and from the plaza along the Arien road.  Amidst the
racks of bridles and backpacks, the smell of fresh leather hangs in the air.
Rather cramped with the occasional barrel or row of metal tools, the shop
still is a common stopping place for those who come to this part of the
city.  

[Exits: south]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.
Kantilus is here, tending to his shop.

<245hp 238m 146mv> 
w
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Center of Arien Plaza
  The Arien plaza stretches in all directions around this point.  From
here, you can make out the locations on the periphery of this almost
perfectly square plaza.  Travelers head to and from a gate to the west,
filling the square with merchants and others, passing through the city by
way of the Arien road.  Further east, the square eventually leads to the
eastern portion of the city, while a similar passage cuts through a wall a
ways to the south.  The north wall of the plaza is dominated by a series of
shops and taverns, mainly devoted to providing for the merchants who pass
through here.  The exact center of the plaza houses a sizeable granite
fountain, its circular base surrounding a pool whose water source is a
statue of tall caladaran.  The cobblestone ground of the plaza bears shows
many signs of wear and use, the fountain being a popular gathering place for
merchants newly arrived in the city.  A small, square grate sits at the
eastern side of the base of the fountain.  

[Exits: north east south west (down)]
A muscular protector is loitering here, surveying the area casually.

<245hp 238m 145mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

The Northwestern Arien Plaza
  The northwestern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as it
approaches the city walls of Earendam to the west.  Travelers and merchants
wander through the area, mainly heading to, or coming from the west gate of
Earendam to the south.  The edge of the plaza lines a row of shops to the
east, but comes to an end here, where a large inn sits in the crook between
the city wall and the shops to the east, and is marked by the sign of a
flagon and bedroll.

<245hp 238m 139mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.  

[Exits: north south]
A grizzled ethron is here, eyeing people as they enter.

The Arien Way
  The Arien Way tavern's common room is west of here, opening past an
arched entryway.  The end of a wood-panelled hallway, this area connects to
a small anteroom to the south, and a stairwell leads north to the rooms above.

<245hp 238m 137mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  An exit lies to a hallway to
the east, and the bar is further west of here.  

[Exits: east south west]

The Bar of the Arien Way
  Located on the western side of the common room of the Arien Way, this bar
comes to an end here, continuing further north as it hugs the wall.  This
part of the tavern is rather smoke-filled, as it approaches the kitchens,
which lie past a wooden set of double doors to the west.  The common room

<245hp 238m 132mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Bar of the Arien Way
  Located on the western side of the common room of the Arien Way, this bar
runs north and south along the west wall.  Made of sturdy oak, the bar
stands waist-high, lined by the occasional low backed wooden chair.  Behind
the bar are barrels of ale and mead, with the occasional bottle of wine in a
rack on the wall.  Servicing mainly the merchants and their entourages, the
bar seems lacking in the more exotic drinks, despite the relative fineries
of the decor.  The common room continues to the east, while the bar ends to
the south.  

[Exits: north east south]
(White Aura) Tonuska the caladaran is here.
A drunken merchant hunches over the bar.
An older nefortu, Gzayal serves drinks from behind the bar.

<245hp 238m 131mv> 

Tonuska looks at you.

<255hp 238m 151mv> 
l tonuska
Wispy and slight, this Caladaran stands at roughly the height of an
average human male.  Moss, chestnut brown hair is pulled back away from his
face by a leather strand.  A short, broad forehead spans the width of his
face, and thin tufts of hair curl out from above his copper-brown eyes. 
Cherrywood-colored flesh, its ridges shallow by the standards of his people,
is marked by a small knot on his left forearm, and the ridges on the back of
his right hand seem to have been smoothed from repeated rubbing.  From the
left side of his belt hangs a simple, black-stained inkhorn, and a well-worn
beltpouch hangs from the opposite.  
Tonuska is in excellent condition.

Tonuska is using:

<worn on arms>      a pair of chaja armguards

<worn about body>   something
<worn about waist>  an ice-encrusted leather band

<267hp 238m 174mv> 
l
The Bar of the Arien Way
  Located on the western side of the common room of the Arien Way, this bar
runs north and south along the west wall.  Made of sturdy oak, the bar
stands waist-high, lined by the occasional low backed wooden chair.  Behind
the bar are barrels of ale and mead, with the occasional bottle of wine in a
rack on the wall.  Servicing mainly the merchants and their entourages, the
bar seems lacking in the more exotic drinks, despite the relative fineries
of the decor.  The common room continues to the east, while the bar ends to
the south.  

[Exits: north east south]
(White Aura) Tonuska the caladaran is here.
A drunken merchant hunches over the bar.
An older nefortu, Gzayal serves drinks from behind the bar.

<275hp 238m 174mv> 
l
The Bar of the Arien Way
  Located on the western side of the common room of the Arien Way, this bar
runs north and south along the west wall.  Made of sturdy oak, the bar
stands waist-high, lined by the occasional low backed wooden chair.  Behind
the bar are barrels of ale and mead, with the occasional bottle of wine in a
rack on the wall.  Servicing mainly the merchants and their entourages, the
bar seems lacking in the more exotic drinks, despite the relative fineries
of the decor.  The common room continues to the east, while the bar ends to
the south.  

[Exits: north east south]
(White Aura) Tonuska the caladaran is here.
A drunken merchant hunches over the bar.
An older nefortu, Gzayal serves drinks from behind the bar.

<275hp 238m 174mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  The common room continues in
all directions save west, where the bar lines the west wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
An attractive serving girl moves through the common room.

e
e

The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  An exit lies to a hallway to
the east, and the bar is further west of here.  

[Exits: east south west]

<275hp 238m 169mv> 
The Arien Way
  The Arien Way tavern's common room is west of here, opening past an
arched entryway.  The end of a wood-panelled hallway, this area connects to
a small anteroom to the south, and a stairwell leads north to the rooms above. 

[Exits: north south west]

s
<275hp 238m 168mv> 
Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.  

[Exits: north south]
A grizzled ethron is here, eyeing people as they enter.

s
<275hp 238m 167mv> 
The Northwestern Arien Plaza
  The northwestern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as it
approaches the city walls of Earendam to the west.  Travelers and merchants
wander through the area, mainly heading to, or coming from the west gate of
Earendam to the south.  The edge of the plaza lines a row of shops to the
east, but comes to an end here, where a large inn sits in the crook between
the city wall and the shops to the east, and is marked by the sign of a
flagon and bedroll.  

[Exits: north east south]
A merchant's bodyguard scans the crowd, watchful of his charge.
A merchant of Earendam mills about the plaza.

<275hp 238m 166mv> 
w
Alas, you cannot go that way.

s
<275hp 238m 166mv> 
The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

w
w
<275hp 238m 165mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads
west, cutting across the plains which give it its namesake.  Inside, the
Arien Plaza opens, marking the beginning of Earendam proper.  

[Exits: east west]
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.

distance to the west.  Leading through the Plains of Arien to Var Bandor,
the broad strip of stones accomodates a great number of caravans, travelers
and merchants.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Arien Plains
  The flat Arien Plains stretch before you, gray, vast and unchanging. 
Small shrubs grow here and there, surrounded by patches of dry grass, but
for the most part the Plains are unvegetated.  To the south, the Arien Road
travels between Var Bandor and Earendam.

<275hp 238m 148mv> 
w
The Brintor Road
  The wide dirt way known as the Brintor Road leads north through the Arien
Plains, gashing a brown line through the monotony of the prairies.  Deep ruts
carved into the road indicate the passing of carts and caravans seeking
trade with the people of the Brintor Mountains to the north.  South, the
Arien Road leads between Earendam and Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<283hp 238m 157mv> 
The Brintor Road
  The wide dirt way known as the Brintor Road leads north out of the Arien
Plains, now giving way to the rolling foothills of the Brintor Mountains. 
The low scrub bushes that populated the praries are now interspersed with
struggling evergreens and patches of rough grass.  Far to the north you can
make out the outline of the Brintor peaks against the sky.

<283hp 238m 150mv> 
The Brintor Road
  The Brintor Road continues to push through the rolling foothills, leading
to the mountain communities to the north.  Ahead, the Brintor Range towers
majestically, the snow-capped peaks reaching to the heavens.  The evergreens
grow much thicker as the mountains approach, forming into a forest at the
very base of the range.  

[Exits: north south]

<283hp 238m 149mv> 
The Brintor Road
  The Brintor Road leads through the rolling foothills into a a densely
forested region at the base of the Brintor Mountains.  The evergreens
cluster thickly on the rolling hills to the north, forming dense woods known
as the North Forest.  The road narrows somewhat as it enters the forest, but
a good-sized path has been cleared and maintained.  

[Exits: north south]

<283hp 238m 148mv> 
n
The Brintor Road
  The Brintor Road continues through the dense North Forest, twisting and
turning through the lush evergreens.  The ground is carpeted with pine
needles, and the smell of fresh pine sap seems to be everywhere.  Occasional

<291hp 238m 59mv> 
recall
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south down]
A bearded human minstrel is here, holding a small mandolin.
(White Aura) A priest of the Aklaju offers the services of the dark gods.

<291hp 238m 29mv> 
d
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<291hp 238m 28mv> 
s
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
     The bones of a deceased animal are piled here.
     A pair of copper chainmail leggings is here.
     A wooden one-man canoe sits here.
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

<291hp 238m 27mv> 
e
Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Nistaru stands behind the desk, sneering at petitioners.

<299hp 238m 46mv> 
s
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.

merchants oversee dockhands unloading their barges, loading new cargos, and
transporting merchandise.  Beyond the docks flow the murky waters of the
Dantaron river, teeming with rafts and barges.

<225hp 235m 91mv> 
help form of the bull
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Form of the Bull (Form)                                          |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  1.0 rounds
Activation cost :  10 mana
Maintenance cost:  10 mana per round


Syntax: Assume 'Form of the Bull'

The first offensive form that a swordmaster learns, the form of the bull
provides a substantial bonus to all damage they deal with a sword. However,
they will far more frequently miss due to armour class, unless they are
intimately familiar with their weapon.


See also: ARMOR CLASS
The merchant is in awful condition.

the travelers entering and leaving the city, and a roster of those banned

<131hp 104m 104mv> 
e
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

The Outskirts of Var Bandor
  You stand outside the southern wall of Var Bandor.  To the south, the
twin forks of the River Dantaron curve eastward and westward, and between
the silvery lines of water a lush forested area is visible.  To the north,
the Var Bandor docks bustle with activity, merchants yelling at dockhands
and travelers moving about. 

[Exits: north east south west]

  The solid stone walls of Var Bandor rise to the west, casting a shadow on

merchants oversee dockhands unloading their barges, loading new cargos, and
transporting merchandise.  Beyond the docks flow the murky waters of the

<131hp 120m 127mv> 
n
Outside the Eastern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the west.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the north and south are solid stone, with murder slits.  East of
the gates, the docks of Var Bandor bustle with activity as merchant barges
are loaded and unloaded.  

[Exits: north east south west]
An alatharya dockhand strides along, heading for his next task.

w
<131hp 120m 126mv> 
Inside the Eastern Gatehouse
  The eastern gatehouse of Var Bandor opens before you, the towering walls
of the city rising to the north and south.  A close watch is being kept on
the travelers entering and leaving the city, and a roster of those banned
from the area is kept nearby.  To the west, Aragol Street runs to the heart
of Var Bandor, and to the east is the docks area.  

[Exits: east west]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

<131hp 120m 125mv> 
w
Aragol Street
  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the east, the eastern gatehouse leads to the docks.  

[Exits: east west]

[Exits: east west]

n
<131hp 120m 120mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<131hp 120m 119mv> 
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

<131hp 120m 118mv>

  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.

<131hp 120m 116mv> 
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<131hp 120m 115mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  Raddin Street
deadends at a stone wall to the east, and returns to the west.  North is a
run-down flophouse, and a large tavern to the south is decorated with a sign
proclaiming it to be the Tipsy Swordmaster.  

[Exits: (north) east south west]

<131hp 120m 112mv> 
s
The Wench's Lute
  This shop lies just off of the east end of Raddin Street, and is exactly
as dingy as one might expect for the surroundings.  One of the windows is
boarded over, and the other is made of bubbled, foggy glass.  An imitation
Harrudim rug covers most of the uneven floor, and a roughly made counter is
toward the east side of the room.  Instruments are mounted on the walls
along with dim lights, providing examples of the shop's wares.  A wooden
doorway leads west.  

[Exits: west]
An unsavory human woman tends the counter.

<156hp 193m 152mv> 
help form of the serpent
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Form of the Serpent (Form)                                       |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  1.0 rounds
Activation cost :  5 mana
Maintenance cost:  5 mana per round


Syntax: Assume 'Form of the Serpent'

The form of the serpent allows a swordmaster to move with the sinuous
swiftness of the serpent, significantly increasing their chance to dodge
attacks, as well as kicks; furthermore, they will never miss an attack due to
the opponent's armour class. However, the heightened precision will cause a
reduction in all outgoing melee damage.


See also: ARMOR CLASS, DODGE

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends

<184hp 270m 190mv> The Tipsy Swordmaster
  The Tipsy Swordmaster is a tavern frequented by the less wealthy
mercenary classes of Var Bandor.  Filled with thick smoke from tobacco
pipes, the large common room of the tavern is filled with the loud sounds of
drinking warriors.  Some scattered tables are filled with boisterous
warriors to the east and west, and the common area is to the south.  Through
some well-travelled doors, the street lies north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<184hp 270m 189mv> 
w
A Quiet Corner
  While filled with the same tables as other parts of the bar, this corner
seems a little quieter.  A small wooden stage rises up on the west wall for
entertainers, but it shows signs of disuse.  The entrance to the bar is
east, while some scattered tables are south.  

[Exits: east south]

Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

<192hp 270m 182mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center

abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty.

Aragol Street
  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty.

[Exits: east west]

<192hp 270m 176mv> 
Inside the Eastern Gatehouse
  The eastern gatehouse of Var Bandor opens before you, the towering walls
of the city rising to the north and south.  A close watch is being kept on
the travelers entering and leaving the city, and a roster of those banned
from the area is kept nearby.  To the west, Aragol Street runs to the heart
of Var Bandor, and to the east is the docks area.  

[Exits: east west]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

<192hp 270m 175mv> 
Outside the Eastern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the west.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the north and south are solid stone, with murder slits.  East of
the gates, the docks of Var Bandor bustle with activity as merchant barges
are loaded and unloaded.  

[Exits: north east south west]
An alatharya dockhand strides along, heading for his next task.

<192hp 270m 174mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Eastern Docks of Var Bandor
  You stand near the edge of the docks of Var Bandor.  To the east, the
river Dantaron flows, murky and gray.  Its waters teem with rafts and
barges, merchants and travelers.  The docks themselves hum with activity,
dockhands unloading barges, loading new cargos, and transporting
merchandise. To the west, the stone walls of the city loom above the dock
area.

[Exits: north east south west]
A citizen of Var Bandor strolls along.
A recently disembarked traveler strolls along the docks.

<192hp 270m 173mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
By the Docks
  The wooden docks of Var Bandor are arrayed to the west, bustling with
merchants, travelers, dockhands, and various other people.  The walls of the
city itself rise beyond the dock area, grand stone edifices designed to
protect the inhabitants of Var Bandor.  The river Aragol flows northward to
a junction.  Here, the pilings of the docks drive deep into the muddy bottom
of the water which swirls sluggishly along.  Large cleats are wound with
thick ropes for mooring, and filthy canvas fenders hang off the edges of the
docks.

<192hp 270m 171mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Aragol River
  The Aragol river runs swiftly over shallow rocks and small, dark pools. 
To the west, up against the banks of the river, there are trees and brush. 
It is dark between the trees, and a shadow of a cloud moves across the
leaves.  Vast plains stretch out on the opposite side of the river, and far
away, far beyond the plains, rise mountains in the sun.  Northwards, the
river passes the jutting, wooden docks of Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

<192hp 270m 170mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Aragol River
  The river slows into calm eddies and easy currents as it passes over deep
salmon pools.  The trees to the west thin as they near the banks of the
river.  There is a slight chattering from somewhere within them.  On the
opposite side, the plains are broken by fields of high grass.  They bend and
weave with the winds.  Beyond the plains, there is a distant line of
mountains.

The Aragol River
  The river flows here at a gentle pace, burbling softly as it flows
northward.  Rocks and stones are visible through the crystal clear water,
only a few inches below its surface.  Wild woods and brambles of Nendor
forest rise along the steep banks of the river to the east and west,
preventing travel in either direction.  The river flows more quickly to the
north, while a large lake lies to the south.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Headwaters of the Aragol
  Rocks and stones are visible through the clear waters of the lake beneath
you, which mark the beginning of the Aragol River to the north.  Jasa Lake
yawns before you to the south and east, its still surface rippling softly at
the breeze and reflecting the clouds, sun, and moon as they pass by.  The
rocks beneath the surface of the lake cause the beginning of the river to
gurgle merrily, and a few fish are visible darting about in the shallows.  A
small, sandy beach marks off the lake to the west, and is followed by a line
of trees.

burble softly over submerged rocks here.  The body of the lake opens
southward, its serene expanse reflecting the sky.  A small, sandy beach is
to the east, beyond which a reedy plain lies.

<199hp 270m 172mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Waterlogged Beach
  A small beach is here, its thick brown sand almost entirely saturated
with water.  Footprints of both animals and recently-passed travellers are
sunk into the wet sand, here, forming tiny lakes of their own.  The beach
itself is low-lying, only barely venturing above the level of water within
the lake itself.  To the south, the beach slips beneath the waters into the
shallows.  Westward, the water of the lake gurgles softly as it flows into
the Aragol River.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A large dragonfly buzzes around.

<199hp 270m 171mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Dirty Beach
  The beach here is an even mix of mud and sand which is crossed with the
tracks of a myriad animals.  The reeds are rather thin here, their long
stalks towering nearly six feet tall.  The reeds continue to the east, but
thin slightly as the ground becomes drier.  A sandy beach cradles the body
of the lake to the south and west, while a thick wall of reeds blocks your
passage to the north.

<199hp 270m 170mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Sparsely-Treed Marsh
  A few amphibious trees grow from the ground here, their mud-caked roots
holding the trunk of the tree high above the level of the ground.  They have
grown rather towering due to lack of competition for sun and nutrients and
thus nearly obscure the sky from view, their thick, flat leaves rustling
gently in the breeze.  A few animals have made their homes within the thick
roots of the tree.  Without a view to the sun, the ground below is
perpetually damp and is covered with a carpet-like layer of grass.  The
ground becomes less grassy and becomes muddy and damp to the south and east,
while it becomes a mix of sand and dirt to the west.  

[Exits: east south west]
A chipmunk skitters through the grass.

A Muddy Marsh
  Very little is here, other than a few short grasses and lots of mud.  The
air is rank with the smell of dead fish, mold, and humidity.  To the north,
a few trees bathe the ground in shade.  Southward, a small sandbar lies
half-submerged in the lake.  The nondescript marsh continues to the east,
while a sandy shoreline rims Jasa Lake toward the west.

A Marshy Plain
  The ground here is almost like a sponge.  Footprints left by passing
animals form tiny pools all around, and the air reeks of humidity.  A few
trees cast gently swaying shadows on the ground, aiding in the maintenance
of the wet ground.  Reeds grow nearly four feet high here, yet mostly marsh
grasses have sprouted up in the shadows of the trees.  The reeds thin out to
the west, where the body of the lake is visible over the tops of the
plantlife.  The reedy marsh continues to the north and south.

The Shallows of Jasa Lake
  The water here is shallow, no more than a foot and a half deep.  The
ground beneath the water is lined with a smooth layer of sand with a few
rocks interspersed.  The non-submerged land to the east is home to a number
of amphibious plants, which grow up to the edge of the water.  A sandbar
lies north, and a muddy ground stretches to the south and east.  The lake's
waters become significantly deeper as one moves further westward.

A Path Between the Reeds
  A path winds through the reeds here, leading toward the shallows to the
north and west, and the reedy marsh to the south.  The plants here are
particularly dense, their brown tassled tops rustling loudly with every
interruption.  This trail wends its way chaotically through the plants,
twisting and turning within the overwhelming plantlife.

  The path here is relatively wide and well-used.  There is virtually no

An Overgrown Path
  The dirt here was once well-packed, yet intrepid plants have burst
through its surface and populated the area.  The ground itself is quite dry,
yet the air retains its thick smell of dampness.  A wall of reeds rises to

A Deviant Path
  Breaking out of the plantlife around it suddenly, this small path heads
to the east and south.  Walls of plants rise around you, standing nearly
eight feet tall in places.  The reeds rustle faintly at every interruption,

through the reeds to the west, yet the only way northward is entirely

Near a Dilapidated Hut
  The overgrown path to the east and south opens here before a seemingly
abandoned hut.  Originally much like the homes of Jaras Village to the
southwest, this hut seems to have been subjected to a number of floodings. 
Its walls bow out at the bottom, and the wood of the building is stained,
cracking, and mouldering all over.  The area around here looks as if it was
once part of the village but has been overrun with plants for many years.  A
number of reptilian footprints pock the mud, giving it an uneven appearance.
The doorless frame to the east leads into the hut, and a particularly dense
wall of reeds blocks passage to the north.  

[Exits: east south west]
A young srryn slinks through here.

A Dilapidated Hut
  The walls of this hut are almost entirely rotted through, bowing out near
the bottom.  A narrow window opens to the north, through which a number of
reeds have poked their tassled heads.  Little light filters into the room,
save from the doorframe to the west and a rather large hole in the northeast
corner of the roof.  Water drips from the hole in the roof, keeping the
uneven ground perpetually damp.  Reptilian footprints cover the mud in
small, water-filled craters, and a few body-shaped divots are sunk deep in
the mud in the northwest corner.  A boarded up door blocks passage to the
east.  

[Exits: (east) west]
A young srryn slinks through here.
(!) Rysoisha, an emerald-scaled srryn woman, crouches here.
Rysoisha says, 'If you're looking for something to do, I got a favor to ask. You ready to begin?'

An Overgrown Path
  The air here is thick and damp, giving a nearly tangible aura of humidity
to the locale.  The dirt here is tightly packed, much like that of the
village to the southwest.  What marks the difference between here and there,
however, is the abundance of tall plants that rise about you.  A few small
paths have been made through the plants, winding toward the north, west, and
south.  Two perilously molded buildings loom eastward, leaving only a small
space to pass between them.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A horned lizard plods slowly through the grass.

An Overgrown Marsh
  This marsh looks as if it was once part of the village to the southwest,
but has been long since abandoned.  The trademark reeds of Jasa Lake revel
in their control of the land here, taking up more than their share of area. 
A few thin trails that are lined with reptilian footprints have been made
here, winding around some of the larger plants.  A path that appears to be a
convergence of these small trails winds away toward the north and west,
while a highly dilapidated hut stands eastward.

A Rugged Marsh
  The ground here is covered with brush and thick bushes.  A few thin trees
stand tall near the south, casting patches of shade on the ground.  Tangled
bushes and thorny thickets grow close to the muddy ground, serving to make
passage on foot rather difficult.  A wall of thorns and tangled vines over
which the top of Mt.  Enrien is visible grows to the south, blocking
passage.  The tree covered marsh continues to the east.  The ground to the
north and west is far less unruly, its flora consisting more of tall reeds
than unruly woods.

A Reedy Marsh
  The plantlife grows so thickly here that it is difficult to pass through
it without creating a large amount of rustling noise.  Standing nearly eight
feet in places, the reeds have become a home to many animals, as can be seen
by the slither marks and small footprints left in the mud, and the sounds
that seem to come from some ambient source.  The reeds thin a little to give
way to brambles eastward, where a few trees loom.  The marsh continues as it
is here to the west, toward the body of the lake, while a small path is
barely visible through the growth to the north.  

[Exits: north east west]
A green grass snake slithers about here.

A Reedy Marsh
  The plantlife grows so thickly here that it is difficult to pass through

A Reedy Marsh
  The patch of ground here is very muddy and is marked with many deep
reptilian footprints from creatures of varying sizes.  Reeds sprout from the
mud in abundance, towering nearly seven feet high in places.  Mount Enrien is
visible over the tops of the plants to the south far in the distance, while
more immediately south the plants simply continue.  The flora thins
northward, becoming slightly more easily passable, and the marsh continues
like this to the east.

A Marshy Plot, Overrun by Reeds
  This area of the marsh is entirely covered by assorted grass, weeds, and
plantlife.  A few random stones are buried in the mud here, creating small
pockets of space where the plants do not intrude.  A small, ramshackle house
with a wild rosebush clinging to its mouldering surface stands to the east. 
The mass of plantlife here thins slightly to the north, giving way to a
small yet passable path.  The marsh continues southward.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<98hp 158m 183mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Behind a Small Shack
  Marsh grasses and weeds cover the ground in this locale, rustling softly
at any disturbance.  Each blade of grass is crowned with a tassled head, and
stands about five inches shorter than most of the lavender-capped weeds.  A
few brambles make their presence known, most of which cling to the back of
the hut to the west.  The back wall of the shack is mildewed and dirty but
is otherwise entirely featureless.  A path leads through the plants toward
town to the north, while the flora grows more wildly to the east.  

[Exits: north east]

Near a Fishing Village
  The path here morphs from a half-dirt path broken with weeds to a hard
packed mud path which leads toward the body of the fishing village.  The
road breaks around the low grasses which line it, opening both toward the
lake's edge and toward a small hut to the southwest.  Eastward, the path
turns into the grasses, nearly disappearing from view.

<98hp 158m 181mv>

In a Fishing Village
  Looping around the side of a fishing hut, the mud and clay path here is
very well-defined against the wild grasses and reeds which grow further to
the east.  Bordered by the pebble-covered beach to the north, the small road
appears as if it was made by the earth itself rather than by the feet of
men.  A myriad tall grasses rise to the south, all but covering the deeply
chipped whitewash of the hut which lies beyond.  A glassless window peeps
through the grass on the hut's wall, about at the height of a human's head. 
The path continues westward toward the village, while it appears to sink
into the earth to the east.  

[Exits: north east west]
An adolescent caladaran wanders the village.

In a Fishing Village
  Following the pebble-filled shoreline to the north, the ground here is
alternately covered with pebbles and firmly-packed dirt.  The passing of
hundreds of feet have worn both soil and mud to a smooth finish here, where
only a few errant weeds dare to grow.  A small pier is anchored into the
shore to the north, jutting out into the low-lying shallows of the lake. 
The hard packed ground continues to the east and west, and the center of the
village lies southward.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<107hp 183m 197mv>

At the Base of a Small Pier
  Lofted from the ground by a number of heavy rocks and a pair of rusted
metal fastening rods, this small pier provides the fishermen of the town a
launch point for their boats.  A number of metal rasps line the pier,
creating places for boats to be tied when not in use.  The wood of the pier
itself is covered with a thin layer of greenish slime yet is otherwise in
good condition.  The pier continues northward, jutting into the waters of
the lake.  The village itself is to the south, while the shoreline extends
lazily to the east and west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

On a Small Pier
  A small wooden pier is here, lined with metal anchors to which small
fishing boats may be tied.  The wood of the pier is covered with a thin
layer of slime which is marked only by the lines created by the dragging of
filled fishing nets.  A platform which casts the water in perpetual shadow
is about twenty feet above the surface of the water, supported by the wooden
pillars which rise from the water to the east and west.  The platform
continues to the north, while the pier's base is anchored to the ground to
the south.

Below a Wooden Platform
  Surrounded by thick wooden pillars to the east and west, the water here
is quite calm.  Above you is a wooden platform with a few hanging bits of
algae and moss.  The wooden platform appears in relatively good condition in
spite of the plantlife, with very few signs of stress or cracking.  The sky
is visible through the slats of the platform, casting a shimmering pattern
of light and dark on the surface of the water.  A small pier juts out
beneath the platform to the south, while the body of the lake continues to
the north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<107hp 183m 194mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
On Jasa Lake
  Flat and pristine, the clear waters of Jasa Lake stretch out before you. 
With a clear view to the sky, the air here becomes warm during the daytime
and provies an expansive scene of the stars by night.  Small disturbances in
the water's surface due to insects and fish create quiet noises which
add to the serenity of this place.  The lake continues uninterrupted to the
north, east, and south, while a thick wooden platform is held above its
surface to the south.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
A caldaran farmer tends to the arrowheads.

The Headwaters of the Aragol
  Rocks and stones are visible through the clear waters of the lake beneath
you, which mark the beginning of the Aragol River to the north.  Jasa Lake
yawns before you to the south and east, its still surface rippling softly at
the breeze and reflecting the clouds, sun, and moon as they pass by.  The
rocks beneath the surface of the lake cause the beginning of the river to
gurgle merrily, and a few fish are visible darting about in the shallows.  A
small, sandy beach marks off the lake to the west, and is followed by a line
of trees.

headwaters to the south and east.  The beach itself runs only two feet back
from the edge of the water before fading into mud, yet sand and stones are
visible beneath the brightly clear water.  A muddy marsh continues past this
beach to the west, while its reeds spill northward, blocking passage.

A Gently-Rising Slope
  The soil here is drier than that which lies on the lower lands to the
east.  The ground is covered with grass, and numerous trees similar to those

A Lightly-Treed Marsh
  A few wispy trees are all that mark this small marsh above average waist
level.  Grasses and reeds dominate the muddy land, and create a quiet
rustling sound whenever they are disturbed by wind or movement.  The

<107hp 183m 183mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Shallows of Jasa Lake
  The waters of Jasa Lake lie here, motionless save for light shimmers
created by passing wind and canoes.  A few tall reeds grow in the shallows
here, for the crystal clear water seems to be no more than five inches deep.
Flies and Waterstriders buzz about the area, making the leaves and water
surface feel very much alive.  A thin line of beach heads northward,
following the curve of the lake.  The shoreline continues to the west, where
the ground grows less sandy and more muddy.  The shallows continue to the
south, while the lake itself opens to the east.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A dark-furred fisher stalks about in the shallows.

<107hp 183m 182mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
On Jasa Lake
  Flat and pristine, the clear waters of Jasa Lake stretch out before you. 
With a clear view to the sky, the air here becomes warm during the daytime
and provies an expansive scene of the stars by night.  Small disturbances in
the water's surface due to insects and fish create quiet noises which
add to the serenity of this place.  Northward, the waters of the lake begin
to flow to the headwaters of the Aragol River.  The lake itself continues to
the south and east, while the shallows lie serenely to the west.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
A fisherman sits in his boat, net plumbing the depths.

add to the serenity of this place.  The lake continues in every direction,

Near the Headwaters of the Aragol
  Flowing toward the Aragol River to the northwest, the waters of the lake
burble softly over submerged rocks here.  The body of the lake opens
southward, its serene expanse reflecting the sky.  A small, sandy beach is

<107hp 183m 177mv> 
e
A Waterlogged Beach
  A small beach is here, its thick brown sand almost entirely saturated
with water.  Footprints of both animals and recently-passed travellers are
sunk into the wet sand, here, forming tiny lakes of their own.  The beach
itself is low-lying, only barely venturing above the level of water within
the lake itself.  To the south, the beach slips beneath the waters into the
shallows.  Westward, the water of the lake gurgles softly as it flows into
the Aragol River.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<107hp 183m 176mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Muddy Depression
  Jasa Lake is only a short distance to the south, and appears to be
encroaching on the soil.  Stagnant, boggy water conspires with the masses of
decaying plants to generate a thoroughly unpleasant smell and swarms of
annoying flies.  The ground rises to firmer, drier heights to the north and
west, while the truly waterlogged beach of Jasa Lake is south.  

[Exits: north south west]
A srryn ruffian prowls here.
A srryn ruffian prowls here.
A srryn ruffian prowls here.

<107hp 183m 175mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Grassy Hill
  This hill is covered with long, tenacious prairie grass, bending low with
each gust of the wind.  Geese can be seen and heard moving through the
grass, hunting for seeds.  The ground here is surprisingly firm, perhaps
owing to the density of grass roots just beneath the surface.  To the north
is a gap between this hill and the next, while the hill slopes away to
flatter land to the east and south.  

[Exits: north east south]

The Headwaters of the Aragol
  Rocks and stones are visible through the clear waters of the lake beneath
you, which mark the beginning of the Aragol River to the north.  Jasa Lake
yawns before you to the south and east, its still surface rippling softly at
the breeze and reflecting the clouds, sun, and moon as they pass by.  The
rocks beneath the surface of the lake cause the beginning of the river to
gurgle merrily, and a few fish are visible darting about in the shallows.  A
small, sandy beach marks off the lake to the west, and is followed by a line
of trees.

headwaters to the south and east.  The beach itself runs only two feet back
from the edge of the water before fading into mud, yet sand and stones are
visible beneath the brightly clear water.  A muddy marsh continues past this
beach to the west, while its reeds spill northward, blocking passage.

A Lightly-Treed Marsh
  Two thin trees are all that mark this small marsh above average waist
level.  Grasses and reeds dominate the muddy land, and create a quiet
rustling sound whenever they are disturbed by wind or movement.  A tiny
beach lies to the east, while the marshland vegetation fades to simple grass
to the west.  Southward, the marsh continues.

The Aragol River
  The river flows here at a gentle pace, burbling softly as it flows
northward.  Rocks and stones are visible through the crystal clear water,
only a few inches below its surface.  Wild woods and brambles of Nendor
forest rise along the steep banks of the river to the east and west,
preventing travel in either direction.  The river flows more quickly to the
north, while a large lake lies to the south.  

[Exits: north south]

<107hp 183m 165mv> 
The Aragol River
  The river continues through the plains, flowing more swiftly now,
downward into Var Bandor.  The mountains rise up along either side of the
river, close against the banks.  The waters are not so very steady, churning
white with foam, and running across tumbled rocks.

On the Bank of the Aragol River
  A short distance from the nearby settlements, the sounds of people are
largely cut off by the thick-branched trees around you.  On the other side
of the trees, the Aragol River flows, making its meandering way north to
meet the Dantaron.  Small animals scurrying along the ground are visible by
their disturbance of the grass, and occasionally the splashes they make
diving into the water.  To the north, the country opens out into rolling,
green hills.  

[Exits: north south]

<107hp 183m 156mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Open-Air Smithy
  This smithy is open to the air, sheltered by a wooden roof with a hole
for ventilation.  At its center, a great stone furnace glows red-hot, its
enormous leather bellows protruding from one side.  From a row of hooks
along one side of the roof, various smithying and measuring tools are hung. 
Near the furnace is a huge iron anvil along with a barrel of water.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bucket of water stands by the anvil.
     A black iron anvil is here.
     A great stone furnace is here, radiating tremendous heat.
An ethron blacksmith is here, forging iron hoops.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Rising Chalk Hill
  You stand on the side of a low hill in the Lithling Freehold.  The chalky
ground is covered in tough green grass, and there is very little in the way
of trees or bushes.  The ground continues sloping upwards to the north,
cresting a short distance away.  The slope evens out to the west and south. 
Southwards, several small, simple buildings are clustered together in a
modest hamlet.  The hill continues descending to the east.  A few stunted
shrubs of bracken and heather vie with the grass but do not seem to be
thriving.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<116hp 209m 173mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Square Yard
  A tall oak shelters this open yard.  Roughly square, L-shaped fences
block off the corners.  Gates which once fitted into the openings facing in
each direction have long fallen off, and only one can be seen, half-covered
by grass at the edge of the yard.  The ground is hard, packed earth, the
occasional rock showing through.  To the southwest, over the fence, a low,
tumbledown stone building sits next to a paddock.  East, the smells of fire
and metal hang about what seems to be a smithy.  Two small houses sit to the
north, slightly ramshackle and unkempt.  Weeds grow around a tired, tiny
farmhouse to the south, a single bright yellow forsythia bush growing beside
the door.  Westward the open lands of the freehold spread out, a path
meandering its way along through them.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<116hp 209m 172mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Green, Open Field
  Tough green grass covers the hilly country of western Lithling, rising
and falling slightly with the rolling hills.  Southwards, the waist-high
grass is increasingly dotted with a shrub or low tree, as the terrain draws
closer to the Aragol River and the marshes of Jasa just beyond.  A wooden
gate opens into a paddock in the same direction, a small farm outbuilding
leaning next to it.  East, a fenced-off yard of packed dirt stands in the
shade of a tall oak.  Small buildings surround the yard, forming a small
hamlet.  A path meanders west, and the open country rises northwards to a
chalky hill.  

[Exits: north east (south) west]
A downlands hare watches its surroundings alertly.
A russet-colored fox prowls here.

A Path Over a Chalk Hill
  A small path makes its way over a low, grassy hill.  The terrain is
gentle and rolling, though it rises into ever-rougher and barer hills to the
west.  The Arien Plains can be seen far off in the distance to the north,
stretching beyond the horizon.  About you, tough green grass carpets the
ground.  The hill appears to be comprised of chalk - bits of white stone
show through the ground cover.  The path continues to the south, descending
and flattening into the bank of the river Aragol.  To the north, it passes
by a low thatched building.  An open field lies down the hill to the east,
and the hill steepens upwards to the west.

A Rickety Farmhouse
  This small farmhouse is rather ramshackle building, with a tumbledown
rear wall.  Made from a mix of hewn planks and wattle-and-daubed plaster,
the home's ceiling relatively low.  Roofbeams are darkened with soot,
bunches of herbs and onions rubbing shoulders with a modest selection of
cookware.  Two windows with woven-twig shutters let in some light, and a
doorway leads north.  A narrow double bed stands against a wall, and a table
and braided rug stand in front of the stone fireplace.  

[Exits: north]

<116hp 209m 154mv> The Aragol River
  The Aragol river runs swiftly over shallow rocks and small, dark pools. 
To the west, up against the banks of the river, there are trees and brush. 
It is dark between the trees, and a shadow of a cloud moves across the
leaves.  Vast plains stretch out on the opposite side of the river, and far
away, far beyond the plains, rise mountains in the sun.  Northwards, the
river passes the jutting, wooden docks of Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

w
<116hp 209m 153mv> 
Alas, you cannot go that way.

n
<116hp 209m 153mv> By the Docks
  The wooden docks of Var Bandor are arrayed to the west, bustling with
merchants, travelers, dockhands, and various other people.  The walls of the
city itself rise beyond the dock area, grand stone edifices designed to
protect the inhabitants of Var Bandor.  The river Aragol flows northward to
a junction.  Here, the pilings of the docks drive deep into the muddy bottom
of the water which swirls sluggishly along.  Large cleats are wound with
thick ropes for mooring, and filthy canvas fenders hang off the edges of the
docks.  

[Exits: north south west]

w

The Eastern Docks of Var Bandor
  You stand near the edge of the docks of Var Bandor.  To the east, the
river Dantaron flows, murky and gray.  Its waters teem with rafts and
barges, merchants and travelers.  The docks themselves hum with activity,
dockhands unloading barges, loading new cargos, and transporting
merchandise. To the west, the stone walls of the city loom above the dock
area.

<342hp 262m 191mv> Outside the Eastern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the west.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the north and south are solid stone, with murder slits.  East of
the gates, the docks of Var Bandor bustle with activity as merchant barges
are loaded and unloaded.

merchants oversee dockhands unloading their barges, loading new cargos, and
transporting merchandise.  Beyond the docks flow the murky waters of the
Dantaron river, teeming with rafts and barges.

[Exits: east south west]
A citizen of Var Bandor strolls along.

  You stand outside the north wall of Var Bandor.  In the distance to the

on either side.  To the west, a large docking area has been built alongside
the river's murky waters.  The docks are humming with activity, merchants
overseeing the offloading of their goods, travelers disembarking, and
citizens of Var Bandor milling about.

A Ferry Station

brown barrier to merchants, carts, and foot travelers.  A small wooden dock
has been erected at the water's edge, and several large ferries run by
riverfolk carry passengers back and forth between the Arien Road and the
outskirts of Var Bandor.

The Dantaron River
  The winding Dantaron River turns to the east, flowing by the city of Var
Bandor.  The placid, muddy waters ripple gently as they run their course,
eventually leading to Earendam eastward.  The stone walls of Var Bandor
tower menacingly to the south, and north and south of the river ferry
stations have been set up.

slick with condensed moisture and growths of fungus.  There is a musty air
to the natural passage that leads north.  Many footprints mar the soft dirt
of the cave floor, packing it into a regular path in some areas.

A Damp Cave
  The damp cave continues, leading into the darkness to the north, and
toward the light of a cave mouth to the south.  The cave walls drip with
moisture, and subterranean fungi grow in colored patches.  The dirt of the
floor is packed by many footprints.  

[Exits: north south]

<97hp 101m 191mv> 
s
The Mouth of the Cave
  A gap in the face of the hill opens into a large cave.  The walls are
slick with condensed moisture and growths of fungus.  There is a musty air
to the natural passage that leads north.  Many footprints mar the soft dirt
of the cave floor, packing it into a regular path in some areas.  

[Exits: north south]
A black cave bat clings to the wall.
A black cave bat clings to the wall.

<97hp 101m 188mv> 
A Path to a Hill
  To the north, the path veers sharply toward a cluster of low foothills. 
An opening in the face of the nearest hill leads into a cavern, and to the
south, the lower foothills spread vastly.  Far in the distance, the peaks of
the Brintor Mountains tower above the horizon, a grand spectacle in the
background.  

[Exits: north south]

<97hp 101m 187mv> 
A Path Through the Foothills
  A small path formed by the recent passing of wagon wheels leads through
the foothills, sinking deeply into the earth of the foothills.  To the
north, the trail bends toward a group of foothills rising above the others. 
To the west, the trail returns toward the Brintor Road.  

[Exits: north west]
