<390hp 334m 201mv> 
help mongoose
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Form of the Mongoose (Form)                                      |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  1.0 rounds
Activation cost :  20 mana
Maintenance cost:  20 mana per round


Syntax: Assume 'Form of the Mongoose'

Imitating the exotic mongoose, this notoriously stylish form allows a
swordmaster to strike successively in combat, for each blow he attempts to
land. These attacks may miss or be blocked as with any other.

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A small group of men
to the south mill around the mercenary's guild, while a small house lies
north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 334m 218mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

w
<390hp 334m 217mv> 
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.  

[Exits: north east south west]

Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

<390hp 334m 213mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.

<390hp 334m 208mv> 
w
Iron Street
  Iron street is in a working class part of Var Bandor, and is far from
being one of the nicer areas in the city.  Men walk about along the street
going about their business, and few seem to notice you here.  Some small,
cramped houses line the streets between the larger warehouses, and some
children wearing ragged clothes can be seen playing outdoors.  The people
here do not seem as happy as those in the nicer parts of the city--a faint
air of oppression hangs over the working class folk of Iron Street.  To the
east is Sadrent Road.  

[Exits: east (south) west]

<390hp 334m 207mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Empty House
  This house seems to have been lived in rather recently, but the tenants
have since moved on in their existences.  A few, ragged blankets still line
the northern wall, however, judging from the droppings left behind, they got
their most recent use from some sort of rodent.  You can exit the house to
the north by squeezing through some loosely hung boards.

A young scholar of Var Bandor walks along the street.

<390hp 334m 204mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Leather Shop
  A thin layer of dust is visible throughout this building, which clearly
was once a leather shop of some sort.  Bare hooks line the walls, where once
merchandise must have hung.  An old counter sits near the back, emptied and
dusty.  A small sign tacked up to the wall indicates that the prior owner
was forced to close shop due to a family emergency, and that there is no
planned date of re-opening.  To the north, you can hear the sounds and
bustle of Iron Street.  

[Exits: north]
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.

<390hp 334m 201mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Tanner's Shop
  Exotic skins and hides of all types are on display here.  The local
proprietor pays good money for the hides brought in by rangers and others of
their profession.  Some half-finished hides are stretched out on wooden
frames behind the counter and yet others are still curing in a small shed in
the far corner of the store.  Iron street lies to the north.  

[Exits: north]

<390hp 334m 199mv>

Iron Street
  Iron street is in a working class part of Var Bandor, and is far from
being one of the nicer areas in the city.  Men walk about along the street
going about their business, and few seem to notice you here.  Some small,
cramped houses line the streets between the larger warehouses, and some
children wearing ragged clothes can be seen playing outdoors.  The people
here do not seem as happy as those in the nicer parts of the city a faint
air of oppression hangs over the working class folk of Iron Street. 
Incongruously, a great frosted glass window fronts a shop that stands apart
from the surrounding buildings, its roof obviously raised.  A very fresh
coat of whitewash is apparent upon the walls of the building.  

[Exits: east south west]

<390hp 334m 198mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Brightly-Lit Shop
  A fortune's worth of glass fronts this shop, its meticulous frosting
obscuring the dreary cobbles of Iron Street.  A fireplace set into the side
wall wards off the damp and fills the room with a fragrant pine scent;
enough to mute the acrid tinge from the tannery next door.  Thin stone
columns support the raised ceiling, making this building taller than those
around it.  Above, a massive and opulent golden chandelier lights the shop,
its smoke and those of the steel sconces about the room darkening the roof's
wooden beams.  At the back of the store is a low, wide counter, providing an
easy work surface for final clothing alterations.  

[Exits: north]
A plump, middle-aged woman makes alterations to a dress on the counter.

<390hp 334m 210mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 334m 209mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Run-Down Weaponry
  This small store is particularly cramped and showing of age.  The ceiling
is cracked across the center, and the paint and plaster look aged and in
some need of repair.  Despite this, examples of the shop's unusual wares
hang along the walls on display, made primarily of wood and iron.  Weapons
of all types are arrayed throughout the shop, leaning or mounted.  The floor
is worn and rickety, and the shop's main counter is battered and worn from
years of sales.  Smaller work can be done in a small kiln in the back room,
but that seems more for repairs or modifications than to create the massive
wares the shop sells.  Raddin Street lies through the door to the north.  

[Exits: north]
A grizzled, scarred alatharya works within the shop.

<390hp 334m 208mv> 
n
n

<390hp 334m 207mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Saurian Armory
  This armory is unusually hot, presumably both because of the kiln against
the shop's north wall, and because of the tastes of its clientele.  An anvil
sits prominently near it, with a variety of tools stewn haphazardly about
the room.  Examples of the shop's unique wares hang from the walls, the
mounted skull-masks and intricately carved metal plates leering from the
aging walls.  Various hide and bone fetishes serve as the room's only other
apparent decorations, giving the entire affair a far more barbarous feel. 
The floor is marked by small scorches, where still-hot metal made a lasting
impression upon it.  To the south is Raddin Street, and the far cooler air
of the city.  

[Exits: south]
A huge, red-scaled srryn blacksmith tends his shop.

Raddin Street

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 334m 202mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Dingy Office
  This one-room office is small and hopelessly seedy.  Dirty grey plaster
is cracked and bubbled in many places, stains and discolorations covering
the surface.  The roofbeams sag wearily, and the creaky floor is bowed and
warped.  Equally flimsy chairs are lined against the eastern wall.  The room
smells of damp and mold, and apparently hasn't been cleaned in years.  A
high desk, built to eliminate the need for a stool, sits opposite the
chairs.  An incredibly grimy window is made of dozens of thick, blurry panes
of cheap glass.  The window admits slightly less light than the open doorway
beside it which leads north out of the room.  

[Exits: north]
(!) A burly ethron mercenary paces about his office.
The ethron mercenary tells you, 'Hello there. You interested in some work?'

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  Raddin Street
deadends at a stone wall to the east, and returns to the west.  North is a
run-down flophouse, and a large tavern to the south is decorated with a sign
proclaiming it to be the Tipsy Swordmaster.  

[Exits: (north) east south west]
A battered and scarred gladiator guards the entrance to the tavern.

<390hp 334m 220mv>

n

<390hp 334m 220mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Flophouse
  The room reeks of alcohol and other smells that aren't so easily
recognizable.  A small, ragged rug lies on the wooden floor, creaky, but by
no means run down.  A plain check-in desk sits in the middle of the room,
and a small brownish stool just behind that.  A few other chairs that don't
look stable enough to support much weight lie scattered about but that's it
in the way for furniture.  

[Exits: south]
A drunken soldier has collapsed on the floor of the flophouse.

<390hp 334m 219mv> 
s
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  Raddin Street
deadends at a stone wall to the east, and returns to the west.  North is a
run-down flophouse, and a large tavern to the south is decorated with a sign
proclaiming it to be the Tipsy Swordmaster.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A battered and scarred gladiator guards the entrance to the tavern.

w
<390hp 334m 218mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A small group of men
to the south mill around the mercenary's guild, while a small house lies
north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 334m 217mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Discount Guides of Var Bandor
  A small room fronts this establishment, a curtained-off door concealing
anything further in.  A creaky old desk fills entirely too much of the room,
covered in papers and carefully-stacked scrolls.  The walls are covered in
old handbills announcing bounties long since collected, gladiatorial bouts
from at least a year ago, and a few advertisments for local shops.  The
floor is kept cleaner than anything else in the place, and it too bears the
signs of too many feet walking over it.  

[Exits: south]
(!) A modest-looking woman waits for potential customers.

<390hp 334m 213mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 334m 212mv> 
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 334m 211mv>

Sadrent Road

<390hp 334m 209mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
All You Knead Bakery
  Two entrances lead into this corner bakery, from Sadrent Road on the west
and Dretch Street to the north.  Many-paned windows on each wall allow
natural light, providing a view of the streets through the bubbled glass.  A
seat is built under the western window, with room for two.  A few brightly
painted tables occupy the space, notably a long magenta table and a round
teal table.  The walls are a soft, inviting yellow and decorated with local
art.  A large counter displays a plethora of baked goods and supports a
heavy, steaming apparatus.  Further in, an oven is kept warm and the bakery
shelves stocked.  A staircase leads up to a private apartment.  

[Exits: north west (up)]
     A hastily-painted sign sits on the counter.
In the back, Nupane rolls out some dough.
A tattooed alatharya, Tefory, works the coffee apparatus.

<390hp 334m 206mv> 
Dretch Street
  The dingy cobbled street is narrow and flanked by looming tenements or
ancient houses, many hollowed out by flame or disrepair.  Spherical
magelights shine day and night atop tall iron poles, illuminating the
perpetual muck that accumulates on the road.  The smell of baking bread
drifts out of the building to the south.  

[Exits: east south west]
Zilba Gralci floats nonchalantly through the air.

<390hp 334m 215mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Sald Street
  Sald Street is a narrow, winding avenue that closely resembles a
forgotten alley.  The broken cobblestones are damp with rainwater,
indicating a malfunctioning drainage system.  The houses in this
neighborhood are wretched, torn-apart things, filthy and barely habitable. 
To the east is the run-down shop known as Ogat's Goods, and to the west
Dretch Street intersects with Sald Street.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A shifty-eyed vagrant stumbles along, glaring about spitefully.

<390hp 334m 214mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Sald Street
  A neat row of double-stacked townhouses lines either side of Sald Street.
A thin strip of green grass goes down the middle of the street, dotted with
short shrubs.  Each home has a small porch out front with a raised bed of
soil.  Most have chrysanthemums but a few have set up small herb gardens in
the place, or are growing other flowers.  The homes look cheaply made but
are in good repair, all freshly painted and with new, bleach-white oiled
parchment in the windows.  The street looks to have been recently re-paved
with smooth, regular setts and a well-drained gutter.  One of the homes to
the east is open to you.  

[Exits: north east south]
A drunken aelin, dressed in tattered rags, staggers around.
A drunken aelin, dressed in tattered rags, staggers around.

<390hp 334m 213mv> 
scan e

=== 1 east ===
A greasy street urchin walks barefoot through the city.


<390hp 334m 213mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Well Lived-In Home
  This small home looks to have been recently renovated it features
somewhat modern ameneties like an indoor hand-pump, glass-encased flames for
lighting, and vents high on the walls that connect to municipal heating.  A
fireplace against the eastern wall connects to a small cast-iron stove a
breadbox sits on the kitchen counter, a butter crock and a tea-tin atop it. 
There are two separate bedrooms on the northern side of the home the walls
seem fairly thin where the home abuts the neighbour's, and throughout the
home it is relatively easy to hear when the people living upstairs thump
around too loudly.  The furniture in general looks relatively inexpensive,
made from cheap plywood, but it seems decently well constructed.  A large
padded mat covered with dog hair takes up a good-sized spot on the floor,
and bowls of food and water are against the wall.  A door to the west leads
onto the front porch and Sald Street.  

[Exits: west]
A greasy street urchin walks barefoot through the city.

<390hp 334m 210mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Ogat's Goods
  This shop is a bit better kept than the others in the area.  There are no
really glaring problems, just a few minor ones, yet the shop still has an
aged look.  Shelves line the walls, filled with simple tools, and small
weaponry.  The few daggers he carries are formidably worked, but not
elegant.  Some small pieces of armor are on the shelves, slightly dented.  

[Exits: west (down)]
A beggar wanders here, seeking charity.
A greasy street urchin walks barefoot through the city.
Ogat sits here, tending his shop.

broken crib lies set apart from the rest of the rubble, the rocker on one

A Run-down House
  This house is still remotely homely: the owner seems to have done
whatever he could to make it inviting, but did not keep it up well.  A hole
is in one wall, letting the eastern light fall directly on the bed.  You
hear the faint squeaking of many rodents, and skittering claws in the walls.
However, a faded landscape of rolling hills is slowly disintegrating with
time, on the western wall.

<390hp 334m 219mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Secret Chamber
  A secret door opens in the dead-end wall of Sald Street, revealing a dark
and mysterious room.  The sunlight does not penetrate the stone ceiling of
this hidden room, which appeared from the outside to be merely the back of
another building.  An oddly-formed symbol is carved into the wall and
highlighted with red paint.  To the west is a plain wooden door.  

[Exits: north west]
A mysterious hooded man glowers at you from behind his cloak.

manageable.  Blackened wood and brick chunks point in all directions from
the pile, sharp edges and rough surfaces creating a possible hazard.  A
broken crib lies set apart from the rest of the rubble, the rocker on one
side askew from the rest.  

[Exits: north]
A greasy street urchin walks barefoot through the city.
A young man clad in soiled clothes grins menacingly at passersby.

<390hp 334m 210mv> 
n
Sald Street
  Sald Street is a narrow, winding avenue that closely resembles a
forgotten alley.  The broken cobblestones are damp with rainwater,
indicating a malfunctioning drainage system.  The houses in this
neighborhood are wretched, torn-apart things, filthy and barely habitable. 
To the south is a collapsed house.

A Board-covered House
  Bare wooden planks completely cover the walls and ceiling of this house:
once used as patches, they have now become the structure.  A pile of filthy
clothes is in one corner, large, jagged holes are chewed through the cloth
and the stench is terrible.  Mold covers some of the boards: it's amazing
this house is still intact.

A Small Home
  This simple house with stone walls has only one room for everyone to
sleep in.  A wooden door leads out to the square.  The air has a stale
quality to it; this home hasn't been occupied for some time, yet it is
undisturbed.  The small table still has one place set, yet a fine coating of
dust covers the plate.  A wooden fork and spoon are on the sides of the
plate, also dust-coated.  You feel a sense of someone standing near you as
you glance about the chamber.

A greasy street urchin walks barefoot through the city.

<390hp 328m 217mv> Dretch Street
  The dingy cobbled street is narrow and flanked by looming tenements or
ancient houses, many hollowed out by flame or disrepair.  Spherical
magelights shine day and night atop tall iron poles, illuminating the
perpetual muck that accumulates on the road.  Set away from the road behind
a tall wrought iron fence, an expansive, multi-story brick building
dominates most of the northern side of the street.

<390hp 328m 213mv> 
w
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the east, Dretch street leads into
the most notorious neighborhoods of Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north east south]

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 328m 209mv> 
e
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 328m 208mv> 
e
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A small group of men
to the south mill around the mercenary's guild, while a small house lies
north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<390hp 328m 207mv> 
s
A Dingy Office
  This one-room office is small and hopelessly seedy.  Dirty grey plaster
is cracked and bubbled in many places, stains and discolorations covering
the surface.  The roofbeams sag wearily, and the creaky floor is bowed and
warped.  Equally flimsy chairs are lined against the eastern wall.  The room
smells of damp and mold, and apparently hasn't been cleaned in years.  A
high desk, built to eliminate the need for a stool, sits opposite the
chairs.  An incredibly grimy window is made of dozens of thick, blurry panes
of cheap glass.  The window admits slightly less light than the open doorway
beside it which leads north out of the room.  

[Exits: north]
(+) A burly ethron mercenary paces about his office.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
l ethron
This ethron has retired from adventuring to aid the guards of Var Bandor.
Now working as a mercenary captain, he looks to hire adventurers to collect
bounties on bandits and criminals plaguing the countryside.  His green skin
is criss-crossed with pale scars, attesting to his years of experience in
the field.  
The ethron mercenary is in excellent condition.

<390hp 334m 217mv> 
e
All You Knead Bakery
  Two entrances lead into this corner bakery, from Sadrent Road on the west
and Dretch Street to the north.  Many-paned windows on each wall allow
natural light, providing a view of the streets through the bubbled glass.  A
seat is built under the western window, with room for two.  A few brightly
painted tables occupy the space, notably a long magenta table and a round
teal table.  The walls are a soft, inviting yellow and decorated with local
art.  A large counter displays a plethora of baked goods and supports a
heavy, steaming apparatus.  Further in, an oven is kept warm and the bakery
shelves stocked.  A staircase leads up to a private apartment.  

[Exits: north west (up)]
     A hastily-painted sign sits on the counter.
In the back, Nupane rolls out some dough.
A tattooed alatharya, Tefory, works the coffee apparatus.

Sald Street
  Sald Street is a narrow, winding avenue that closely resembles a
forgotten alley.  The broken cobblestones are damp with rainwater,
indicating a malfunctioning drainage system.  The houses in this
neighborhood are wretched, torn-apart things, filthy and barely habitable.

Dretch Street intersects with Sald Street.

A Run-down House
  Bare wooden planks completely cover the walls and ceiling of this house:
once used as patches, they have now become the structure.  A pile of filthy
clothes is in one corner, large, jagged holes are chewed through the cloth
and the stench is terrible.  Mold covers some of the boards: it's amazing
this house is still intact.  

[Exits: north]
A filthy alleycat searches through the discarded refuse for food.

<390hp 334m 212mv> 
recall
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south]
A bearded human minstrel is here, holding a small mandolin.
(White Aura) A priest of the Aklaju offers the services of the dark gods.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the central altar set in the far
north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  A pair of flaming braziers are
near the southern doorway, which burn red from the light of the smoking
coals.  The air is filled with the cloying smell of myrrh, which drifts
through the air from no apparent source.  

[Exits: north south west]

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Kaagn Row
  Kaagn row heads east and west along the north banks of the Dantaron, a
road paved with well-worn cobblestones hewn from the Brintors.  Pylons block
off the way to the south, except where a high arched wooden bridge splits
off from the road to cross the Dantaron.  The entirety of the north side of
the street is taken up with a temple of blocks carved from obsidian.  Tall
black steps lead up to the entrance, which is framed by columns, which have
all been carved into complicated piece of statuery.  The tall columns give
the building a gigantic feel, and it seems to tower over the entire street. 

[Exits: north east south west]

w
<390hp 334m 99mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Corner of Scero Way and Kaagn Row
  Scero Way heads in from the north here, turning eastward into Kaagn Row. 
The west side of Scero is taken up by a low stone building, but the only
barrier to travel from the south are the banks of the Dantaron, past a set
of stone pylons.  On the river you can make out various barges and other
merchant travel, bringing goods in and out of Earendam along the Dantaron. 
Northeast of here towers a building of black obsidian blocks, complete which
lofty columns which give it an air of enormous height.  

[Exits: north east south]
A pudgy shuddeni catches a nap in a chair, protected from the sun's rays by a thick black awning.

The Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron make their way through the city of
Earendam.  Passing between the city's mercantile district to the north, and
the old city to the south, the river is one of the principal avenues for
trade into and out of the city.  The waters of the Dantaron are deep here,
clouded by the dark mud of its bottom, and the frequent river-traffic along
its course.  To the east, the Dantaron flows under a high arched bridge. 
Westward, it flows towards its egress from the city's walls.  

[Exits: north east south west]

By the Earendam Docks
  The Dantaron River flows from the plains to the east, making its way
under the city wall of Earendam to the west, and eventually to the Uthlin
Ocean.  To the north and south the river is lined with the Earendam docks
area, bustling with merchants unloading cargo and passengers disembarking
from barges.  Narrow wooden walkways run from one dock to the next, passing
just overhead.  

[Exits: east west up]

The Earendam Docks
  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River
Dantaron, flowing sluggishly to the south under the city wall.  The docks
are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to
move immediately.  An occasional raft or barge can be seen on the river,
arriving or leaving the city.  To the east, the granite walls of Earendam
tower above the dock area.  Several ladders and wooden walkways lead
downward to the water of the river itself.

The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads
west, cutting across the plains which give it its namesake.  Inside, the

The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

<390hp 334m 101mv> 
n
The Northwestern Arien Plaza
  The northwestern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as it
approaches the city walls of Earendam to the west.  Travelers and merchants
wander through the area, mainly heading to, or coming from the west gate of
Earendam to the south.  The edge of the plaza lines a row of shops to the
east, but comes to an end here, where a large inn sits in the crook between
the city wall and the shops to the east, and is marked by the sign of a
flagon and bedroll.  

[Exits: north east south]
A merchant's bodyguard scans the crowd, watchful of his charge.
A merchant of Earendam mills about the plaza.

Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.  

[Exits: north south]
A grizzled ethron is here, eyeing people as they enter.

The Arien Way

a small anteroom to the south, and a stairwell leads north to the rooms above.

<390hp 334m 98mv>

The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  An exit lies to a hallway to
the east, and the bar is further west of here.  

[Exits: east south west]

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
l
The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  The common room continues
north and east, and meets the bar west of here.  

[Exits: north east west]
     A soapstone chessboard sits on a table here.

<167hp 334m 222mv> [15 Swo] Veljik v'Edaris the Master of the Mongoose

<167hp 334m 222mv> 
help factions
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Factions                                                         |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Syntax: finquiry <name>
        factions

Avendar is home to a number of groups, orders, and factions.  Your
reputation with each of these groups is handled by a standing system, which
is often affected by the completion of quests and who or what you kill. 
When you kill NPCs of who are aligned with a faction, your standing with
them, their allies, and their enemies will change.  

Much of the time, your standing with a faction will be neutral, which incurs
no bonus or penalty.  When you are a friend of a faction, NPCs will respond
differently, and at times offer different reactions or services.  When you
are a faction's enemy, at best they will ignore you; at worst, they will
attack you on sight.  Most classes will automatically be considered a friend
of the guild of which they are a member.  

To find out your standing with a given faction, use the finquiry command
on an NPC aligned with it. To see all allied and enemy factions, use the
factions command.

See also: FINQUIRY

<167hp 334m 222mv>

<390hp 334m 218mv> 
The Arien Way
  The Arien Way tavern's common room is west of here, opening past an
arched entryway.  The end of a wood-panelled hallway, this area connects to
a small anteroom to the south, and a stairwell leads north to the rooms above. 

[Exits: north south west]

s
<390hp 334m 217mv> 
Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.  

[Exits: north south]
A grizzled ethron is here, eyeing people as they enter.

<390hp 334m 212mv> 
The Northwestern Arien Plaza
  The northwestern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as it
approaches the city walls of Earendam to the west.  Travelers and merchants
wander through the area, mainly heading to, or coming from the west gate of
Earendam to the south.  The edge of the plaza lines a row of shops to the
east, but comes to an end here, where a large inn sits in the crook between
the city wall and the shops to the east, and is marked by the sign of a
flagon and bedroll.  

[Exits: north east south]
A merchant's bodyguard scans the crowd, watchful of his charge.
A merchant of Earendam mills about the plaza.

<390hp 334m 211mv> 
s
The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

<390hp 334m 210mv> 
w
The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads
west, cutting across the plains which give it its namesake.  Inside, the
Arien Plaza opens, marking the beginning of Earendam proper.  

[Exits: east west]
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.

w
<390hp 334m 209mv> 
The Arien Road
  Outside the western gates of Earendam, the Arien Road stretches into the
distance to the west.  Leading through the Plains of Arien to Var Bandor,
the broad strip of stones accomodates a great number of caravans, travelers
and merchants.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A city worker of Earendam goes about his business.

The Arien Road
  The broad strip of stones known to travelers as the Arien Road stretches
into the distance to the west.  The flat monotony of the Plains of Arien are
the only view to the north and south.  In the distance the gray walls of
Earendam rise, strikingly different from the otherwise featureless
landscape.

<390hp 334m 219mv> 
The Arien Plains
  The flat Arien Plains stretch before you, gray, vast and unchanging. 
Small shrubs grow here and there, surrounded by patches of dry grass, but
for the most part the Plains are unvegetated.  To the south, the Arien Road
travels between Var Bandor and Earendam.  

[Exits: north east south west]

Small shrubs grow here and there, surrounded by patches of dry grass, but
for the most part the Plains are unvegetated.  To the south, the Arien Road
travels between Var Bandor and Earendam.  

[Exits: east south west]

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
w
The Brintor Road
  The wide dirt way known as the Brintor Road leads north through the Arien
Plains, gashing a brown line through the monotony of the prairies.  Deep ruts
carved into the road indicate the passing of carts and caravans seeking
trade with the people of the Brintor Mountains to the north.  South, the
Arien Road leads between Earendam and Var Bandor.

A Path to a Hill
  To the north, the path veers sharply toward a cluster of low foothills. 
An opening in the face of the nearest hill leads into a cavern, and to the
south, the lower foothills spread vastly.  Far in the distance, the peaks of
the Brintor Mountains tower above the horizon, a grand spectacle in the
background.  

[Exits: north south]

<390hp 334m 205mv> 
The Mouth of the Cave
  A gap in the face of the hill opens into a large cave.  The walls are
slick with condensed moisture and growths of fungus.  There is a musty air
to the natural passage that leads north.  Many footprints mar the soft dirt
of the cave floor, packing it into a regular path in some areas.  

[Exits: north south]
A black cave bat clings to the wall.

<390hp 334m 204mv> 
n
A Damp Cave
  The damp cave continues, leading into the darkness to the north, and
toward the light of a cave mouth to the south.  The cave walls drip with
moisture, and subterranean fungi grow in colored patches.  The dirt of the
floor is packed by many footprints.  

[Exits: north south]
A red cave beetle flexes its mandibles threateningly.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
desc + A whip-thin, dark-skinned caladaran stoops here.  His face and skin, from what show  in gaps 
of his piecemeal armor, is dark brown and rugged and rough as old oak bark. His seemingly tough 
textured skin grows even thicker and darker towards each of his joints.  His idly passive demeanor 
and often downcast gaze make him seem  humble or unobtrusive but bright green eyes shimmer 
intelligently. His lithe frame moves with the ease of obvious training and he seems to usually 
gravitate towards empty space.  Lastly you regard the two blades  secured fast about his right side.
  Varying in sizes and work the two swords  are bound in scabbards. The hilt of each blade is  
fairly close together and, at rest,  hang low on his waist.  One of his calloused hands seems to 
constantly linger  about the hilt of one of the two blades. Overall he lurks, slinks, lingers in an 
attempt to be inconspicious. 

Your description is:
A whip-thin, dark-skinned caladaran stoops here.  His face and skin, from what show  in gaps of his
piecemeal armor, is dark brown and rugged and rough as old oak bark. His seemingly tough textured 
skin grows even thicker and darker towards each of his joints.  His idly passive demeanor and often 
downcast gaze make him seem  humble or unobtrusive but bright green eyes shimmer intelligently. His 
lithe frame moves with the ease of obvious training and he seems to usually gravitate towards empty 
space.  Lastly you regard the two blades  secured fast about his right side.  Varying in sizes and 
work the two swords  are bound in scabbards. The hilt of each blade is  fairly close together and, 
at rest,  hang low on his waist.  One of his calloused hands seems to constantly linger  about the 
hilt of one of the two blades. Overall he lurks, slinks, lingers in an attempt to be inconspicious.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
desc
Your description is:
A whip-thin, dark-skinned caladaran stoops here.  His face and skin, from
what show in gaps of his piecemeal armor, is dark brown and rugged and rough
as old oak bark.  His seemingly tough textured skin grows even thicker and
darker towards each of his joints.  His idly passive demeanor and often
downcast gaze make him seem humble or unobtrusive but bright green eyes
shimmer intelligently.  His lithe frame moves with the ease of obvious
training and he seems to usually gravitate towards empty space.  Lastly you
regard the two blades secured fast about his right side.  Varying in sizes
and work the two swords are bound in scabbards.  The hilt of each blade is
fairly close together and, at rest, hang low on his waist.  One of his
calloused hands seems to constantly linger about the hilt of one of the two
blades.  Overall he lurks, slinks, lingers in an attempt to be
inconspicious.  

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
l

shaft, and the miners have begun excavating around it.  The mine shaft
continues west, and opens into the main cave to the east.

<390hp 302m 222mv> 
bg clear
Background cleared.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
bg + Adrajisk began an exhaustive study of discipline throughout Avendar's known
races.  This included the human disciples of Dolgrael, who were
well-established throughout the Republic; the aelin students of the sword;
and the fledgling art of assassinry, which shared its own curious
philosophical edge.  In this process, he was introduced to other artistic
forms which lent themselves to discipline, such as topiary and calligraphy. 
He then began the immense task of synthesizing these possibilities into a
greater whole.  

In time, he would demonstrate the techniques he had developed to others. 
Having passed beyond the primitive psionics of his forebears, he was able to
control his body on an unprecedented level.  He could rapidly heal wounds,
shatter a block of stone with a single strike, levitate objects, or walk
through fire without feeling pain.  These dramatic demonstrations affirmed
not only the primacy of Jalassa's philosophy of discipline, but as well
revealed a depth of potential which rivaled the greatest mages.  He named
this new school of study "ginta'cham'akan", "thought creating form", and
gained his first disciples within the Republic.  



Your background is:
Training in the deep underground caverns of Yithoul was intentionally
brutal.  Some of his fellow trainees related more with the Flame, showy and
direct in their methods.  Some more the void, scheming and controlling.  The
Masters kept extensive notes on the trainees.  Their project had been
established years ago.  A small section of cave set up in a village-esque
manner to house/train/observe the discarded shuddeni infants.  Continually
judging each as the young shuddeni attempted to live in such a situation
ensured only the properly molded would join the ranks of those sent to the
surface.  

Veljik found solace in silence.  He followed neither void nor flame which
was rare.  He seemed to have a talent for stealth but the thought of
sneaking brought an instant grimace to his scarred face.  He was direct, in
his core, but he witnessed how much harder it was for those who got noticed.


He brooded.  He watched, much as the Masters watched, and he waited.  

Somehow he ended up surviving the "camp" and was sent to join the ranks of
the those being sent to the surface.  Survive and prosper were his orders. 
You are the blood of Yithoul.

--------------------------------------------------------------------NEW BACKGROUND------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted 
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place
seemed to conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was 
an effort. A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every
single one. His trek from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the 
beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this 
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.
A soft rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to 
materialize from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity 
around him. Several punches from countless directions
pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed him to unconciousness. 


"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.
"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had 
protected him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.

The two faces turned, mirroring each other in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical 
appearance.

"It is the end with the beginning. It is the beginning with the end. It is perfect."  Veljik rasped.
 

The Grandmaster rose smoothly. Veljik remained seated head deferred to  the wooden floor.
"Begin training, with the ginta'am'akan as well then, Veljik v'Edaris." the old caladaran left the 
room, a piece of paper left where he was once seated.

Adrajisk began an exhaustive study of discipline throughout Avendar's known

Your background is:
Adrajisk began an exhaustive study of discipline throughout Avendar's known

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
bg + Adrajisk began an exhaustive study of discipline throughout Avendar's known
races.  This included the human disciples of Dolgrael, who were
well-established throughout the Republic; the aelin students of the sword;
and the fledgling art of assassinry, which shared its own curious
philosophical edge.  In this process, he was introduced to other artistic
forms which lent themselves to discipline, such as topiary and calligraphy. 
He then began the immense task of synthesizing these possibilities into a
greater whole.  

In time, he would demonstrate the techniques he had developed to others. 
Having passed beyond the primitive psionics of his forebears, he was able to
control his body on an unprecedented level.  He could rapidly heal wounds,
shatter a block of stone with a single strike, levitate objects, or walk
through fire without feeling pain.  These dramatic demonstrations affirmed
not only the primacy of Jalassa's philosophy of discipline, but as well
revealed a depth of potential which rivaled the greatest mages.  He named
this new school of study "ginta'cham'akan", "thought creating form", and
gained his first disciples within the Republic.  



Your background is:
Training in the deep underground caverns of Yithoul was intentionally
brutal.  Some of his fellow trainees related more with the Flame, showy and
direct in their methods.  Some more the void, scheming and controlling.  The
Masters kept extensive notes on the trainees.  Their project had been
established years ago.  A small section of cave set up in a village-esque
manner to house/train/observe the discarded shuddeni infants.  Continually
judging each as the young shuddeni attempted to live in such a situation
ensured only the properly molded would join the ranks of those sent to the
surface.  

Veljik found solace in silence.  He followed neither void nor flame which
was rare.  He seemed to have a talent for stealth but the thought of
sneaking brought an instant grimace to his scarred face.  He was direct, in
his core, but he witnessed how much harder it was for those who got noticed.


He brooded.  He watched, much as the Masters watched, and he waited.  

Somehow he ended up surviving the "camp" and was sent to join the ranks of
the those being sent to the surface.  Survive and prosper were his orders. 
You are the blood of Yithoul.

kungfu swordmaster trainer Master gets assassinated

--------------------------------------------------------------------NEW BACKGROUND------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted 
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place
seemed to conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was 
an effort. A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every
single one. His trek from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the 
beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this 
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.
A soft rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to 
materialize from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity 
around him. Several punches from countless directions
pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed him to unconciousness. 


"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.
"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had 
protected him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.

The two faces turned, mirroring each other in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical 
appearance.

"It is the end with the beginning. It is the beginning with the end. It is perfect."  Veljik rasped.
 

The Grandmaster rose smoothly. Veljik remained seated head deferred to  the wooden floor.
"Begin training, with the ginta'am'akan as well then, Veljik v'Edaris." the old caladaran left the 
room, a piece of paper left where he was once seated.

but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort.

from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

believes iron sharpens iron ultimately and that the unrestrained power of evil actions are a thin 
line of perspective

terrain is very important 
over reacts to any weather
adding this gem of a document for posterity 
---------------------------------------------
The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

Student of swordmaster in yithoul - kungfu style - power of arkhural sect style - strength achieved
through different forms of restraint - long road to restraint

evil nuetral so just not straight murdering all and looting all these street walking hookers, right
from the very beginning, is showing restraint, in his mind

are the biggest threat , says learn to sense their presence from motive alone , if you think they

line of perspective

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this

Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here.

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.

but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.
The two faces turned, mirroring each other in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical
appearance.

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.
The two faces turned, mirroring each other in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical
appearance.
"It is the end with the beginning. It is the beginning with the end. It is perfect."  Veljik rasped.

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.
The two faces turned, mirroring each other in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical
appearance.
"It is the end with the beginning. It is the beginning with the end. It is perfect."  Veljik rasped.
The Grandmaster rose smoothly. Veljik remained seated head deferred to  the wooden floor.

The quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration. The buildings seemed well-crafted
but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. The circular pattern of the place seemed to 
conceal the the place from itself. Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort. 
A little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every single one. His trek 
from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated this to be only the beginning.

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth dawned on him. In this
place, the hidden blade is the most powerful. He understood why he was exiled from his race.A soft 
rustle brings his hands around,  lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize 
from the shadows. His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount of activity around him. 
Several punches from countless directions pummeled him. As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed 
him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?" the old caladaran asked.

"Ak'aginta." He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping. Such precautions had protected
him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have taught me much already."
"What do you believe of the circle?" the caladaran continued, fact stoic.
The two faces turned, mirroring each other in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical
appearance.
"It is the end with the beginning. It is the beginning with the end. It is perfect."  Veljik rasped.
The Grandmaster rose smoothly. Veljik remained seated head deferred to  the wooden floor.
"Begin training, with the ginta'am'akan as well then, Veljik v'Edaris." the old caladaran left the
room, a piece of paper left where he was once seated.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
l
The Mine Shaft
  The picks of the miners have carved this small mine shaft into the solid
granite of the cave wall.  A vein of quartz is visible in the side of the
shaft, and the miners have begun excavating around it.  The mine shaft
continues west, and opens into the main cave to the east.  

[Exits: east west]
A black cave bat clings to the wall.
A burly miner, hardened by years of work, digs tirelessly at the cave wall.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
bg
Your background is:
Student of swordmaster in yithoul - kungfu style - power of arkhural sect
style - strength achieved through different forms of restraint - long road
to restraint

evil nuetral so just not straight murdering all and looting all these street
walking hookers, right from the very beginning, is showing restraint, in his
mind

kungfu swordmaster trainer Master gets assassinated , as dying of poison
warns veljik's the unseen are the biggest threat , says learn to sense their
presence from motive alone , if you think they are there they are there type
shit , veljik goes to earendam and buys into swordmaster guild

bad ass caladaran kungfu master swordmaster that lounges at the looters
chalice - raider highlord and mercenary for the right price - aint got no
friends but is dedicated to making true friends - believes iron sharpens
iron ultimately and that the unrestrained power of evil actions are a thin

terrain is very important over reacts to any weather adding this gem of a
document for posterity --------------------------------------------- The
quiet village had little in the way of ornamental decoration.  The buildings
seemed well-crafted but, seemed more than anything, built for a purpose. 
The circular pattern of the place seemed to conceal the the place from
itself.  Attempting to wander from one building to another was an effort.  A
little over a dozen of the structures, total, veljik caught the eye of every
single one.  His trek from Yithoul had been a long one and he anticipated
this to be only the beginning.  

As he moved through the walkways half sliding his feet the a simple truth
dawned on him.  In this place, the hidden blade is the most powerful.  He
understood why he was exiled from his race.  A soft rustle brings his hands
around, lesser ak'aginta unwavering, a low kick that seemed to materialize
from the shadows.  His eyeless gaze turned to sense an overwhelming amount
of activity around him.  Several punches from countless directions pummeled
him.  As he struggled the unrelenting hands pushed him to unconciousness

"Why are you here?"  The old caladaran asked.  

"Ak'aginta."  He replied, as he habitually adjusted his underwrapping.  Such
precautions had protected him from the Star since his wandering here. 
Keeping his head turned slightly in deference Veljik continued, "You have
taught me much already."  "What do you believe of the circle?"  The
caladaran continued, fact stoic.  The two faces turned, mirroring each other
in demeanor, a sharp contrast drawn in physical appearance.  "It is the end
with the beginning.  It is the beginning with the end.  It is perfect." 
Veljik rasped.  The Grandmaster rose smoothly.  Veljik remained seated head
deferred to the wooden floor.  "Begin training, with the ginta'am'akan as
well then, Veljik v'Edaris."  The old caladaran left the room, a piece of
paper left where he was once seated.  

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
l
The Mine Shaft
  The picks of the miners have carved this small mine shaft into the solid
granite of the cave wall.  A vein of quartz is visible in the side of the
shaft, and the miners have begun excavating around it.  The mine shaft
continues west, and opens into the main cave to the east.  

[Exits: east west]
A black cave bat clings to the wall.
A burly miner, hardened by years of work, digs tirelessly at the cave wall.

<390hp 334m 222mv> 
e
The Mining Camp
  This stretch of cave is crowded with mining equipment, bedrolls for
several men, provisions, and various clutter.  Apparently this is the
temporary camp of a mining party.  Further evidence lies in a mine shaft
sunk into the west wall of the cave, and three mine carts partially filled
with ore.  The main cave continues north and south.  

[Exits: north south west]
     A mining cart carries recently mined ore.
A miner bends to his work, carving away at the cave wall.
A burly miner, hardened by years of work, digs tirelessly at the cave wall.

A Mine Shaft
  The small mine shaft tapers to an end at this point.  Several mining
tools lean against the stone wall, and loose ore, still to be removed,
scatters the ground.  Unhewn granite prevents further passage into the
mountain, and the mine shaft returns toward camp to the east.

<380hp 218m 221mv> 
A Damp Cave
  The damp cave continues, leading into the darkness to the north, and
toward the light of a cave mouth to the south.  The cave walls drip with
moisture, and subterranean fungi grow in colored patches.  The dirt of the
floor is packed by many footprints.  

[Exits: north south]
A black cave bat clings to the wall.

<380hp 218m 218mv> 
s
The Mouth of the Cave
  A gap in the face of the hill opens into a large cave.  The walls are
slick with condensed moisture and growths of fungus.  There is a musty air
to the natural passage that leads north.  Many footprints mar the soft dirt
of the cave floor, packing it into a regular path in some areas.  

[Exits: north south]
A red cave beetle flexes its mandibles threateningly.

<380hp 218m 215mv> 
s
A Path to a Hill
  To the north, the path veers sharply toward a cluster of low foothills. 
An opening in the face of the nearest hill leads into a cavern, and to the
south, the lower foothills spread vastly.  Far in the distance, the peaks of
the Brintor Mountains tower above the horizon, a grand spectacle in the
background.  

[Exits: north south]

<380hp 218m 214mv> 
A Path Through the Foothills
  A small path formed by the recent passing of wagon wheels leads through
the foothills, sinking deeply into the earth of the foothills.  To the
north, the trail bends toward a group of foothills rising above the others. 
To the west, the trail returns toward the Brintor Road.

<380hp 218m 212mv> 
The Brintor Road
  The wide dirt way known as the Brintor Road leads north out of the Arien
Plains, now giving way to the rolling foothills of the Brintor Mountains. 
The low scrub bushes that populated the praries are now interspersed with
struggling evergreens and patches of rough grass.  Far to the north you can
make out the outline of the Brintor peaks against the sky.  A small side
path, formed by the recent passing of wagon wheels, leads toward a small
cluster of hills to the east.

The Brintor Crossroads
  The Arien Road stretches endlessly through the plains to the east and
west.  From the north, the wide dirt track known as the Brintor Road cuts
through the prairie, intersecting with the more widely traveled stone
highway.  Deep ruts in the dirt mark the passage of wagon wheels to the
north, toward the Brintor Mountains.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A sun-bleached signpost stands in the grey soil.
A man of Earendam walks along the road, heading for Var Bandor.

into the distance to the east and west.  The flat monotony of the Plains of
Arien are the only view to the north and south, the neatly laid stones of
the road providing the only change.  To the east, a wide dirt road
intersects with the Arien Road.

travels between Var Bandor and Earendam.  

[Exits: east south west]

<387hp 235m 203mv> 
A Ferry Station
  The waters of the Dantaron River flow placidly to the south, a muddy
brown barrier to merchants, carts, and foot travelers.  A small wooden dock
has been erected at the water's edge, and several large ferries run by
riverfolk carry passengers back and forth between the Arien Road and the
outskirts of Var Bandor.  
A wooden sign stands at the edge of the docks.

[Exits: north south]
A ferryman stands on the docks, offering his services for gold.

<387hp 235m 202mv> 
whe
The Dantaron River
  The winding Dantaron River turns to the east, flowing by the city of Var
Bandor.  The placid, muddy waters ripple gently as they run their course,
eventually leading to Earendam eastward.  The stone walls of Var Bandor
tower menacingly to the south, and north and south of the river ferry
stations have been set up.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<387hp 235m 200mv> The Outskirts of Var Bandor
  You stand outside the north wall of Var Bandor.  In the distance to the
north, the Dantaron river splits into two forks which flow around Var Bandor
on either side.  The ground here is muddy and level, with little grass
growing. Behind you to the south, the stone wall of the city overshadows
the outskirts. 

[Exits: north east south west]

<387hp 235m 199mv> 
Outside the Northern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the south.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the east and west are solid stone, with murder slits.  To the
north, the river Dantaron splits into two mighty forks which flow by Var
Bandor on either side.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A fisherman hauls along his day's catch.

<387hp 235m 198mv> 
Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

<387hp 235m 197mv> 
s
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the east and west is a squalid
alley.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<387hp 235m 190mv> 
e
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends

known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  Raddin Street
deadends at a stone wall to the east, and returns to the west.  North is a

proclaiming it to be the Tipsy Swordmaster.

<387hp 235m 187mv> 
s
The Wench's Lute
  This shop lies just off of the east end of Raddin Street, and is exactly
as dingy as one might expect for the surroundings.  One of the windows is
boarded over, and the other is made of bubbled, foggy glass.  An imitation
Harrudim rug covers most of the uneven floor, and a roughly made counter is
toward the east side of the room.  Instruments are mounted on the walls
along with dim lights, providing examples of the shop's wares.  A wooden
doorway leads west.  

[Exits: west]
An unsavory human woman tends the counter.

<387hp 235m 185mv> 
The Tipsy Swordmaster
  The Tipsy Swordmaster is a tavern frequented by the less wealthy
mercenary classes of Var Bandor.  Filled with thick smoke from tobacco
pipes, the large common room of the tavern is filled with the loud sounds of
drinking warriors.  Some scattered tables are filled with boisterous
warriors to the east and west, and the common area is to the south.  Through
some well-travelled doors, the street lies north.  

[Exits: north east south west]
