w
A Quiet Corner
  While filled with the same tables as other parts of the bar, this corner
seems a little quieter.  A small wooden stage rises up on the west wall for
entertainers, but it shows signs of disuse.  The entrance to the bar is
east, while some scattered tables are south.  

[Exits: east south]
Swordmaster Mengjaal rests on a chair in the corner, aloof from the rowdiness.

<400hp 252m 196mv> 
s
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<400hp 252m 195mv> 
s
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.  

[Exits: north south]

<400hp 252m 194mv>

in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the west is the guild of watchers, while Naidji Alley lies to
the east.

Commerce Street
  Surrounded by newly constructed buildings, Commerce Street winds through
the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,
the gold that flows from the prosperous trade evident in the buildings, the
clothing of the citizens, and the meticulous maintenance of the streets.  To
the north is an elegant inn, and to the east is Ilrin Street.

[Exits: north east west]

<400hp 252m 188mv> 
The Bank of Var Bandor
  The most noticeable feature in the Bank is the line of teller windows
along the far wall.  The keen eyes of bankers peer out from behind the
barred windows, scrutinizing their clientele.  Plants and small wooden
benches provide the decor for those waiting for service, and a doorway leads
southwards onto Commerce Street.  

[Exits: south]

Commerce Street
  Surrounded by newly constructed buildings, Commerce Street winds through
the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,
the gold that flows from the prosperous trade evident in the buildings, the
clothing of the citizens, and the meticulous maintenance of the streets. 
Commerce Street turns south and east at this point, and to the west is a
magnificent structure, the headquarters of the Var Bandor Merchant Council. 

[Exits: east south (west)]

<400hp 252m 185mv> 
Commerce Street
  Surrounded by newly constructed buildings, Commerce Street winds through
the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,
the gold that flows from the prosperous trade evident in the buildings, the
clothing of the citizens, and the meticulous maintenance of the streets.  To
the east is the armory, and to the west is the cartographer's store.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<400hp 252m 184mv> 
e
The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of
the fire.  Shirts made of fine steel, leggings, sleeves, and assorted mails
of all type are all on display hanging from the walls.  Besides the forge
near the back of the store, the rest of the building looks immaculately
clean giving a sense of regality not normally associated with a smithy-type
shop.  You can exit back to the west.  

[Exits: west]
The armorer shows off his wares.

<400hp 252m 181mv> 
list
The Gleaming Blade
  Torches adorn both side walls and sit upright in their gilded holders. 
Their light flickers and causes the various bladed weapons to glint sharply.
Several studded maces, and various other weapons of destruction are lined
along the walls in weapon racks.  A spinning stone wheel, used for
sharpening blades, stands near the back of the shop with a bucket of water
next to it to help with the enormous amount of heat produced during the
process.  You can exit back to the west.  

[Exits: west]
( 3) An ancient stone tablet lies here.
The weaponsmith polishes his arsenal, keeping it in good condition.

The Merchant's Coffer Inn
  An elegantly decorated building of the finest construction, the
Merchant's Coffer Inn serves the elite mercantile class of Var Bandor with
its gourmet dishes and superb wines.  Meticulously clean, the tables are
carefully laid with fine silver and delicate ceramic dishes.  The faint
sound of sophisticated music floats through the Inn.  

[Exits: south west]
A young scholar of Var Bandor walks along the street.
The Innkeeper surveys his domain with a domineering glare.

<406hp 272m 193mv> 
n
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,
and to the west Commerce Street leads to the merchant quarter.  

[Exits: north east south west]

[Exits: north south]

<406hp 272m 189mv> 
n
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A simple pine staff lies on the ground.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<406hp 272m 188mv> 
n
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north south]

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was

<406hp 272m 180mv> 
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south]
A bearded human minstrel is here, holding a small mandolin.
(White Aura) A priest of the Aklaju offers the services of the dark gods.

<406hp 272m 90mv> 
exam altar
This midnight black altar is made from carved ebony.
A carved ebony altar holds:
     Nothing.

<406hp 272m 90mv> 
s
The Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the central altar set in the far
north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  A pair of flaming braziers are
near the southern doorway, which burn red from the light of the smoking
coals.  The air is filled with the cloying smell of myrrh, which drifts
through the air from no apparent source.  

[Exits: north east south]

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Kaagn Row
  Kaagn row heads east and west along the north banks of the Dantaron, a
road paved with well-worn cobblestones hewn from the Brintors.  Pylons block
off the way to the south, except where a high arched wooden bridge splits
off from the road to cross the Dantaron.  The entirety of the north side of
the street is taken up with a temple of blocks carved from obsidian.  Tall
black steps lead up to the entrance, which is framed by columns, which have
all been carved into complicated piece of statuery.  The tall columns give
the building a gigantic feel, and it seems to tower over the entire street. 

[Exits: north east south west]

<406hp 272m 84mv> 
e

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Corner of Valectus Street and Kaagn Row
  South Valectus comes from the north here, turning west where it becomes
Kaagen Row.  South and east of this corner, stone pylons line the banks of
the Dantaron, source of a good Earendam's commerce.  Northwest of here
towers a building of black obsidian blocks, complete with lofty columns
which give it an air of enormous height.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<406hp 272m 83mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron head north and south, skirting the
city's mercantile district to the west.  Here, the river splits around the
Isle of Salyra, flowing north and east under bridges around the island. 
Southward, the river bends to the west, as it approaches the old part of the
city.  

[Exits: north east south west]

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Under a Wooden Bridge
  The Dantaron flows beneath this high wooden bridge, dividing the two
halves of the city of Earendam.  Muddy beaches line the north shore,
perpetually damp from the lack of sunlight.  The placid waters of the river
continue to the south under the bridge, and passes into the open to the east
and west.  

[Exits: east south west]

<406hp 272m 81mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Bend in the Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron bend northward here, winding their way
through the city of Earendam.  Northwest of here is the Isle of Salyra,
whose rocky shores are the namesake to the tower which rises from the center
of the island.  The river splits as it heads around the island to the north
and west, passing under high bridges.

Bend in Dantaron Avenue
  Dantaron Avenue bends south and east here, turning as it follows the
course of the river.  Winding along with the river, Dantaron runs through
southern Earendam, lining the north border of the old city.  To the west, an
arched bridge crosses the river, leading toward a tower on a small island in
the river.

<406hp 289m 100mv>

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Dantaron Avenue
  The broad course of Dantaron Avenue runs parallel to the river which is
the street's namesake.  Located just south of the river, Dantaron Avenue
heads east and west through Old Earendam, skirting the edges of the
buildings to the south.  North of here, a small warehouse sits on the edge
of the river, used for the storage of the mercantile goods which pass along
the river.  Southwards is a fashionable clothing store, one of the
forerunners of the street as a trendy shopping district.  

[Exits: east south west]

<406hp 289m 99mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Bend in Dantaron Avenue
  Dantaron Avenue bends north and west here, turning as it follows the
course of the river.  Winding along with the river, Dantaron runs through
southern Earendam, lining the north border of the old city.  Hanging gardens
and vines cascade out of the windows of the two-storied dining establishment
to the east, giving off a faint but fragrant aroma even from here.  

[Exits: north east west]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.

<406hp 289m 98mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Sea Spire
  A spiral staircase fills the centre of this room, allowing light in from
above to shine on the climbing vines that line each side of it, slim
waterfalls dividing the creepers and forming a shallow pool.  Several tables
are set poised about, oriented such that both the splashing of water and the
positioning afford each diner a modicum of privacy in conversation.  A
curving wooden bar is set before the back wall, ensuring only staff move in
and out of the door to the kitchens.  Several paintings line the other
walls, deftly set in spots where the light from above will highlight them
throughout the day.  

[Exits: west up]
A slender aelin waitress lingers by the staircase between orders.
A well-manicured host stands attentively by the door.

<406hp 289m 96mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Dantaron Avenue
  The broad course of Dantaron Avenue runs parallel to the river here,
heading north and south through Old Earendam.  Lining the western border of
the old city, Dantaron provides easy access to the river for the noblemen
who have interests along the riverfront.  West of here is a small warehouse,
which sits directly on the river.  To the east, Dantaron connects with
Jyndril Avenue, which skirts the southern edge of the Patrician's palace.  

[Exits: north east south]

<406hp 289m 95mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Jyndril Avenue
  Jyndril Avenue heads east through Old Earendam, skirting the southern
outskirts of the Patrician's Palace, whose walls are directly north of here.
On the south side of the street sits the Watcher's Conclave, charged with
protecting Earendam's peace.  To the west lies Dantaron Street, which hugs
the course of the river.  

[Exits: east south west]

Jyndril Avenue
  Jyndril Avenue heads east and west through Old Earendam, skirting the
southern outskirts of the Patrician's Palace, whose walls are directly north
of here.  On the south side of the street sits the Watcher's Conclave,
charged with protecting Earendam's peace.  East lies the intersection of

<406hp 289m 93mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Intersection of Jyndril and Republican Way
  Jyndril Avenue meets Republican Way in a four-way junction here,
connecting various parts of Old Earendam.  Jyndril skirts the edge of the
Patrician's Palace as it heads east and west, while Republican Way comes
south from Corvandil Square to enter the main gates of the palace to the
north.  The view of the palace from here allows a glimpse past the gated
walls, revealing the massive gold dome of the central building and its
meticulously carved marble trappings.  Ringing this junction are lamp posts,
each topped with glowing balls of light, providing illumination to the
junction at night.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A noble citizen of Earendam strolls along the streets.

Jyndril Avenue
  Jyndril Avenue heads east and west through Old Earendam, passing near the
Patrician's palace to the northwest.  North of here lies a relatively simple

<406hp 289m 89mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Intersection of Valvaria Street and Jyndril Avenue
  South Valvaria Street runs north and south through Old Earendam, home to
much of the city's aristocracy, as well as artistic and religious centers. 
This disposition is reflected in the surrounding architecture, which
consists primarily of ancient buildings, all done in the classical
Republican styles, replete with the required columns and marble exteriors. 
The east side of the street is taken up with Earendam's bardic collegium,
home to many of the city's famed musicians.  Elsewhere, Jyndril Avenue
begins to the west, and South Valvaria continues to both the north and
south.  

[Exits: north south west]

South Valvaria Street
  South Valvaria Street runs north and south through Old Earendam, home to

South Valvaria Street
  South Valvaria Street runs north and south through Old Earendam, home to
much of the city's aristocracy, as well as artistic and religious centers. 
This disposition is reflected in the surrounding architecture, which
consists primarily of ancient buildings, all done in the classical
Republican styles, replete with the required columns and marble exteriors. 
The east side of the street is taken up with Earendam's bardic collegium,
home to many of the city's famed musicians.  A more subdued building to the
west displays a frieze depicting armed noblemen over the entrance, marking
it as a school of arms for the gentry.  South Valvaria continues to the
south, but opens in Saldarin square to the north.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<406hp 289m 85mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Entrance to the Bardic Collegium
  The entrance to Earendam's famed bardic Collegium is a showy, almost
gaudy affair, making up in exuberance what it lacks in classical taste.  The
floor of the chamber is a checkerboard of black and white marble, flanked by
supporting pillars of the same material.  Overhead, two massive candelabras
brighten the room, their gilded frames dotting the arched ceiling with a
cascade of golden light.  To both the south and the north, an opening lies
between two pillars, while Valvaria street opens to the west.  

[Exits: north south west]
An elegantly-dressed herald stands by the southen door.

The Entrance Hall of the Four Flowers School
  This wide foyer is sheathed in austere granite, with marble inlaid into
the floor in a simple geometric pattern, pleasing to the eye.  The ceiling
discards most elaborate vaulting common in the area, and has a plain,
decorative edging where it meets the walls.  Each corner of the room holds a
simple flower arrangement set on a woden table.  A well-maintained receiving
desk sits before the doorway leading eastward into the school, and westward
is the door out onto Valvaria Street.  

[Exits: east west]
A young caladaran in a grey robe tends the receiving desk.

South Valvaria Street
  South Valvaria Street runs north and south through Old Earendam, home to
much of the city's aristocracy, as well as artistic and religious centers.

<406hp 289m 78mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Stately Entrance Hall
  This marble-sheathed entrance hall is generously appointed in the
classical styles, with intricate molding in the Republican styles decorating
the pillars that gracefully support the high-vaulted ceiling.  Rich,
burgundy carpeting covers the floor, though the marks of many feet have left
signs of their passage over time.  Paintings and statuery line the sides of
the hall, the assorted objets d'art tastefully kept away from the hands of
the public with simple velvet ropes.  The majority of the building remains
clear of the public, but people stride in not infrequently from the street,
seeking audience with the master of this house, the candidate Moreth Edeno,
whose personal study lies further to the east.  

[Exits: east west]

<406hp 289m 77mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Well-Kept Study
  Mahogany paneling and thickly piled Harrudim carpet create a feeling of
warmth in this room, despite both the height of the vaulted ceiling and
large amount of floor space.  Shaded globes of light provide a steady,
gentle illumination to the room, easy enough to read by.  Solidly built
bookshelves line the northern wall, most packed end to end with well-kept
books, a few knick-knacks occupying the rare empty spaces.  A large desk
occupies a corner near the shelves, a well-used chair left sitting half-out.
A halberd sits hung above the fireplace, which is kept burning steadily in
the wintertime, and left empty in the warmer months.  Two large, comfortable
couches face each other across a coffee table, allowing an easy means to
receive the many guests that stream into and out of this room.  

[Exits: west]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.
A dark-haired man with perfect posture stands here, hands behind his back.
Moreth Edeno faces you, tilting his head in a short nod.

<406hp 289m 76mv> 
l 2.man
Coming to the head of the house of Edeno at an unusually young age,
Moreth still has a particularly youthful countenance.  His dark, nearly
black hair is worn a bit long in a fashionable style, and despite his
serious face, the shape of his mouth seems one inclined to smiles.  His
stance is textbook- perfect, though he carries himself like a man more
heavy-set than his slender frame, typical of the Earendam nobility,
suggests.  A fervent dedicant of Iandir, Moreth has served as a legal
advisor on the Patrician's Council since rising to the head of his house,
abandoning his training in the priesthood when called.  
Moreth Edeno is in excellent condition.

Moreth Edeno is using:
<worn on finger>   the signet ring of the house of Edeno
<worn on torso>    a low-girdled Earendamian chiton of navy and bronze silk
<worn on head>     a gleaming pair of wire-rimmed spectacles
<worn on legs>     a low-girdled Earendamian chiton of navy and bronze silk
<worn on arms>     a draping himation of carmine-bordered brown cashmere
<worn about body>  (Humming) a mantle of earth
<worn about waist> a wide leather zoster plated with bronze
<held>             a smooth mahogany pipe
<branded>          the Sigil of the Iron Crown

South Valvaria Street
  South Valvaria Street runs north and south through Old Earendam, home to
much of the city's aristocracy, as well as artistic and religious centers. 
This disposition is reflected in the surrounding architecture, which
consists primarily of ancient buildings, all done in the classical
Republican styles, replete with the required columns and marble exteriors. 
On the west side of the street is a slightly less picturesque building --
the headquarters of the Patrician's Guard.  A low set of square stairs leads
up to the squat building, whose entrance lies under a door topped with a
roughly carved marble frieze.  The foyer of the Earendam Guardian office
lies to the east.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A muscular protector is loitering here, surveying the area casually.

<406hp 308m 90mv>

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Entrance to the Guard Headquarters
  Built in what passes for a minimalist design in the classical
architecture of old Earendam, the headquarters of the Patrician's guard is
rather sparse.  The only ornamentation are the small pillars which frame the
room's doorways, which lead in all directions save south.  A few low benches
are set against the south wall, to accommodate the occasional citizen who
has business with the Patrician's guards.  

[Exits: north east west]
A member of the Patrician's guard stands at attention.

lead up to both buildings to the east and west.  Continuing to the north is
the street and southward lies East Qalnistra Street.

Dantaron Avenue
  The broad course of Dantaron Avenue runs parallel to the river here,
heading north and south through Old Earendam.  Lining the western border of
the old city, Dantaron provides easy access to the river for the noblemen
who have interests along the riverfront.  Towering to the east of here is
the Patrician's palace, whose walled expanse is directly east of here.  A
break between two buildings leads towards a wooden bridge to the west.  

[Exits: north south west]

w
<406hp 325m 100mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Atop an Arched Wooden Bridge
  This arched bridge crosses the Dantaron, connecting the old city with the
Isle of Salyra, which sits squarely in the river's course.  In the center of
the island is a tower, which rises high above the arch of the bridge.  Off
to either side of the bridge is the river, which flows north and south
below.  

[Exits: east west]

<406hp 325m 99mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
East of the Tower of Salyra
  Rising above the banks of this island are the stones of the Tower of
Salyra, namesake to the order of healers who make it their home.  Made from
old granite, the tower is an old building, with a simple architechtural
style which predates the Republican period.  An open portcullis provides an
entrance into the tower to the west.  Crossing the course of the Dantaron to
the east is an arched wooden bridge, which leads to the south part of the
city.  

[Exits: east west]

<406hp 325m 98mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Foyer of the Tower of Salyra
  The foyer of the Tower of Salyra is dimly illuminated by a torch or two
on its stone walls.  Most notable about the place is the air.  Rather than
the damp, musty feel of most older buildings, the atmosphere of this tower
is rich with the smell of plant life.  Oak doors leave the chamber in the
north and south The foyer exits the tower through a portcullis to the east,
and a large open chamber to the west.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A guard for the tower of Salyra stands at attention beside the portcullis.

<406hp 325m 97mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Birthing Ward
  This large room is made for women in the throes of childbirth.  Half a
dozen beds are arranged neatly in the room, each equipped with a small
footstool for the use of midwives.  Blankets and cloth wrappings are neatly
piled on a table set against the south wall.  Light in the room comes
through a large window in the east wall, which opens to allow the sights and
breezes of the Dantaron.  Above the doors which lead north and west are
small religious icons, depicting holy symbols of the god Jolinn.

<406hp 325m 91mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Sunlit Garden
  Sunlight illuminates this garden, coming from a glass oculus far
overhead.  Nearby, small shrubs and trees form the bulk of the garden, with
the occasional stand of flowers arranged in an aesthetic fashion.  In the
upper regions of the tower, balconies look down on the garden, and are oft
as not covered with draping ivy, which comes down in places to the level of
the floor.  Amidst the garden are a series of trickling fountains, with
smaller ones occupying each corner of the room, and a large fountain sit
squarely in the middle of the garden.  Archways exit the garden in all
cardinal directions.  

[Exits: north east south west]

South of the Tower of Salyra
  Rising above the banks of this island are the stones of the Tower of
Salyra, namesake to the order of healers who make it their home.  Made from
old granite, the tower is an old building, with a simple architectural
style which predates the Republican period.  An open portcullis provides an
entrance into the tower to the north.  Crossing the course of the Dantaron
to the south is an arched wooden bridge, which leads to the south part of
the city.  

[Exits: north south]

<406hp 325m 86mv>

Atop an Arched Wooden Bridge
  This arched bridge crosses the Dantaron, connecting the old city with the
Isle of Salyra, which sits squarely in the river's course.  In the center of
the island is a tower, which rises high above the arch of the bridge.  Off
to either side of the bridge is the river, which flows east and west below.

Dantaron Avenue
  The broad course of Dantaron Avenue runs parallel to the river which is

<406hp 325m 78mv> 
n
The Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron make their way through the city of
Earendam.  Passing between the city's mercantile district to the north, and
the old city to the south, the river is one of the principal avenues for
trade into and out of the city.  The waters of the Dantaron are deep here,
clouded by the dark mud of its bottom, and the frequent river-traffic along
its course.  To the east, the Dantaron flows under a high arched bridge. 
Westward, it flows towards its egress from the city's walls.  

[Exits: north east south west]

w
<406hp 325m 77mv> 
The Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron make their entrance to the city of
Earendam here.  Passing through a raised portcullis from the west, it winds
its way eastward through the city.  The waters of the Dantaron are deep
here, clouded by the dark mud of its bottom, and the frequent river-traffic
along its course.  

[Exits: east south west]

<406hp 325m 76mv> 
w
By the Earendam Docks
  The Dantaron River flows from the plains to the east, making its way
under the city wall of Earendam to the west, and eventually to the Uthlin
Ocean.  To the north and south the river is lined with the Earendam docks
area, bustling with merchants unloading cargo and passengers disembarking
from barges.  Narrow wooden walkways run from one dock to the next, passing
just overhead.  

[Exits: east west up]

<406hp 325m 75mv> 
u
The Earendam Docks
  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River
Dantaron, flowing sluggishly to the south under the city wall.  The docks
are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to
move immediately.  An occasional raft or barge can be seen on the river,
arriving or leaving the city.  To the east, the granite walls of Earendam
tower above the dock area.  Several ladders and wooden walkways lead
downward to the water of the river itself.  

[Exits: north south west down]
     A section of the stone wall is discolored with grime.
A dockhand is here working tirelessly.
A dockhand is here working tirelessly.
A dockhand is here working tirelessly.

The Arien Road
  Outside the western gates of Earendam, the Arien Road stretches into the
distance to the west.  Leading through the Plains of Arien to Var Bandor,
the broad strip of stones accomodates a great number of caravans, travelers
and merchants.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<406hp 325m 73mv> 
The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads
west, cutting across the plains which give it its namesake.  Inside, the
Arien Plaza opens, marking the beginning of Earendam proper.  

[Exits: east west]
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.

<406hp 325m 72mv> 
The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

The Northwestern Arien Plaza
  The northwestern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as it
approaches the city walls of Earendam to the west.  Travelers and merchants
wander through the area, mainly heading to, or coming from the west gate of
Earendam to the south.  The edge of the plaza lines a row of shops to the
east, but comes to an end here, where a large inn sits in the crook between
the city wall and the shops to the east, and is marked by the sign of a
flagon and bedroll.  

[Exits: north east south]
A merchant's bodyguard scans the crowd, watchful of his charge.
A merchant of Earendam mills about the plaza.

<406hp 342m 83mv> 
Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.  

[Exits: north south]
A grizzled ethron is here, eyeing people as they enter.

The Arien Way
  The Arien Way tavern's common room is west of here, opening past an
arched entryway.  The end of a wood-panelled hallway, this area connects to
a small anteroom to the south, and a stairwell leads north to the rooms above.

<406hp 342m 81mv> 
The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  An exit lies to a hallway to
the east, and the bar is further west of here.  

[Exits: east south west]
A broad-shouldered bouncer meanders through the tavern.

<41hp 235m 97mv> 
help dagger
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Dagger (Skill)                                                   |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

Small, bladed weapons, daggers are one of the simplest melee weapons, often
favoured by scholars for this reason, most other professions in Avendar also
receiving training in them. Rogues are more intimately trained in their usage,
learning techniques both flashy and subtle. Typically thrusting or slashing
weapons, due to their length, they are poor at warding off blows though it is
likewise difficult to parry against a dagger. Someone wielding a dagger will
have a harder time getting around a shield, a stone phalanx, or a fighter's
fending.


See also: PARRY

<41hp 235m 97mv> 
help polearm
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Polearm (Skill)                                                  |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

Similar to a spear, but universally requiring both hands to wield and
typically heavier at the head, polearms are often favoured by both fighters
and earth templars, who are taught to best take advantage of both their
defensive and offensive capabilities. Because of their length, they are very
well-suited to defend with. They are suited to usage against opponents who are
dodging, fending, or using a stone phalanx, and unsuited against parrying of
any sort or deflection.


See also: PARRY

<41hp 235m 97mv> 
help polearm
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Polearm (Skill)                                                  |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

Similar to a spear, but universally requiring both hands to wield and
typically heavier at the head, polearms are often favoured by both fighters
and earth templars, who are taught to best take advantage of both their
defensive and offensive capabilities. Because of their length, they are very
well-suited to defend with. They are suited to usage against opponents who are
dodging, fending, or using a stone phalanx, and unsuited against parrying of
any sort or deflection.


See also: PARRY

<41hp 235m 97mv> 
help parry
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Parry (Skill)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

One of the few skills taught by almost all guilds of Avendar, parrying is the
art of fending off an opponent's blows with one's own weapon. It is easiest to
do so with a staff, though polearms and spears are well-suited to it as well.
Swords and exotic weapons are neither good nor poor to one attempting to
parry, though gladiators will parry better with an exotic and swords parry
more effectively when wielded with both hands. Maces, axes, flails, daggers
and whips are in turn less and less suited to parrying with.

Fighters, by virtue of their training in a variety of techniques, will be more
skilled at parrying no matter what the weapon.

Wielding a weapon other than a sword or a spear in one's offhand will inhibit
parrying with the main hand, though gladiators learn techniques to parry
better while offhanding a whip. It is typically easier to parry when skilled
with one's own weapon.

It is particularly difficult to parry against daggers and whips, and easier to
parry polearms.


See also: DUAL WIELD, individual weapon helpfiles

<51hp 258m 118mv> 
help sword
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Sword (Skill)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

One of the most commonly-produced and commonly-trained weapons in Avendar,
swords are simple to learn the basics of, but may take decades to master. The
only weapon with an entire profession dedicated solely to their usage, in the
hands of most others, swords are a particularly average weapon. Typically
slashing or piercing, they range from slender rapiers to massive two-handed
claymores.


See also: PARRY

<51hp 258m 118mv> 
help spear
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Spear (Skill)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

A long shaft with a sharpened tip, spears are typically piercing weapons.
They can be found both as slender javelins requiring a single hand to use, or
thicker-shafted and needing both hands. One-handed spears are typically the
ideal choice for people trained in the usage of shields, as spears are a
superior weapon in a defensive capacity. Other professions skilled in dual
wielding often favour one-handed spears. Fewer guilds emphasize the usage of
two-handed spears, but they are still a relatively commonly used weapon.
Spears penetrate techniques such as fend and stone phalanx quite easily, but
are little use against watchers' deflection.


See also: PARRY

<51hp 258m 118mv> 
help dodge
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Dodge (Skill)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

Dodge is a melee defense skill focused on the avoidance of blows. It is
particularly difficult to dodge flails and polearms, and easier to dodge
whips. Dodge is the favored defense of rogues, but it is taught in many other
schools as well.

All aelin receive a bonus to this skill.


<59hp 278m 139mv> 
l
The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  The common room continues west
and north of here.  

[Exits: north west]
A brown-furred kankoran slurps noisily on a mug of ale.
A brown-skinned caladaran woman sits here, huddled in her robes.
A slender and elegant aelin sits at a table.

<406hp 350m 230mv> 
l aelin
Andralis is a rather handsome aelin, with features marking him as a
nobleman of one of Ilodaiya's houses.  Marked with harsh lines, his face
seems aged by the discipline of a soldier's life, but his eyes tell a
different tale.  With a merry smile, he occasionally greetings a passing
pattern, or runs his hand lovingly over the grain of the wooden table at
which he sits.  
Andralis is in excellent condition.

The Arien Way
  The Arien Way tavern's common room is west of here, opening past an

<406hp 350m 227mv> 
Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.  

[Exits: north south]
A grizzled ethron is here, eyeing people as they enter.

<406hp 350m 226mv> 
The Northwestern Arien Plaza
  The northwestern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as it
approaches the city walls of Earendam to the west.  Travelers and merchants
wander through the area, mainly heading to, or coming from the west gate of
Earendam to the south.  The edge of the plaza lines a row of shops to the
east, but comes to an end here, where a large inn sits in the crook between
the city wall and the shops to the east, and is marked by the sign of a
flagon and bedroll.  

[Exits: north east south]
A merchant's bodyguard scans the crowd, watchful of his charge.
A merchant of Earendam mills about the plaza.

s
<406hp 350m 225mv> 
w
The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

<406hp 350m 224mv> 
w
The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads
west, cutting across the plains which give it its namesake.  Inside, the
Arien Plaza opens, marking the beginning of Earendam proper.  

[Exits: east west]
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.
An Earendam gate guard stands at attention.

distance to the west.  Leading through the Plains of Arien to Var Bandor,
the broad strip of stones accomodates a great number of caravans, travelers
and merchants.

The Earendam Road
  The Earendam Road is a narrow strip of stones, many broken or missing
from the passage of time.  The road was once heavily travelled by caravans
and merchants trading with the mountain outposts to the north, but in recent
years the road has fallen into disuse, and is no longer actively maintained.
The Earendam Road leads north and south through the grasslands.

[Exits: north east south west]

The Earendam Grasslands
  The lush green grasses of the Earendam Grasslands spread before you in
all directions.  The shoulder-high grass sways and whispers in the wind, its
motion giving the grasslands the appearance of a green ocean.  Now and then
the spoor of a plains deer is visible underfoot, but there are no game
trails or other landmarks.

The Earendam Road
  The Earendam Road continues northward toward the Brintor Mountains
through the thickly wooded foothill region known as the North Forest.  Lush
evergreens cluster densely over the rolling hills of the area, a stark
contrast to the barren plains to the south.  The occasional stones of the
road have all but disappeared, and the path consists of a wide dirt band,
packed solid by countless passengers.

<406hp 350m 196mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Earendam Road
  The Earendam Road twists through the North Forest, a plain brown strip of
earth that has been packed solid by the passing of many travelers.  To
either side of the road, towering evergreens flourish.  Now and again the
rustling of a small animal can be heard in the undergrowth, and a multitude
of forest birds twitter in the trees.  The road continues west and south.

A Small Game Trail
  A small game trail has been beaten into the forest floor by the passing
of many small animals.  The occasional rabbit or squirrel can be seen
briefly darting through the undergrowth and vanishing just as quickly.  The
evergreens of the North Forest crowd the narrow path, and the thick brush
makes going slow.  The trail continues to the west, and joins a road to the
east.

The Earendam Road
  As the Earendam Road nears the north edge of the forest, the trees begin
to thin, and the peaks of the Brintor mountains are visible through the
foliage.  The rolling foothills begin to rise in earnest to meet the true
foot of the Brintor range.  As the road breaks through the woods to the
north, a junction of ways is visible in the distance.  To the south, the
road descends into the forested foothills.

The Earendam Road
  The Brintor Mountains tower before you, a narrow mountain trail leading
to the north.  To the south, the ruined Earendam Road leads into the
foothills, and to the west, the North Brintor Road skirts the lower
mountains and foothills of the Brintor range.  Eastward, an enormous
obsidian stone marks the beginning of the Vorinden Road.

At the Foot of the Mountains
  The Earendam Road leads to the foot of a steep mountain face, with the
remnants of an ancient road winding upwards into the steeper peaks.  The
road is covered with rocks at this point, fallen from the cliffs above.  To
the south, the rolling foothills extend as far as the eye can see.  

[Exits: south up]

The Earendam Road
  The Brintor Mountains tower before you, a narrow mountain trail leading
to the north.  To the south, the ruined Earendam Road leads into the
foothills, and to the west, the North Brintor Road skirts the lower
mountains and foothills of the Brintor range.  Eastward, an enormous
obsidian stone marks the beginning of the Vorinden Road.

<406hp 350m 190mv> 
s
The Earendam Road
  The Earendam Road continues north and south through the foothills of the
Brintor Mountains.  The condition of the narrow strip of stones deteriorates
as the distance from Earendam increases, until the missing stones outnumber
the remaining ones.  To the north, the majestic purple peaks tower, rising
from the foothills in breathtaking grandeur.  To the south, the lush North
Forest spreads over the foothills.

Beginning of Vorinden Road
  The Vorinden road begins here, tracing a path to the east, passing
through rocky hills.  Northward, the Brintors tower into the sky, purple
giants that seem ringed with icy white clouds.  The road itself seems seldom
used, and the tell-tale marks of wagons and horses are fainter than the
sparse traffic that the Earendam road sees to the west of here.

<411hp 362m 113mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The End of the Vorinden Road
  The Vorinden road comes to an end here, halting before the walls and iron
gate of the Keep of Kor Thrandir.  Along with stones cleared away from the
road, steel pikes have been erected, each topped with the rotting head of a
shuddeni.  Eyeless, the heads grin down on you as the gates of the keep open
to the east.  

[Exits: east west]

<411hp 362m 109mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Iron Gates of Kor Thrandir
  A large iron gate stands open, allowing passage by the high stone walls
of Kor Thrandir.  A dark blue flag above the gate flaps in the mountain
wind, bearing the Lord Protector's iron cross.  The rugged mountain road is
swept clear, rising into paved cobblestone just outside the town walls.  A
series of pikes stand along the outer wall, the grinning, eyeless skulls of
shuddeni stuck upon them.  From here, the great keep of Kor Thrandir is
visible in the distance to the east.  Additional guard posts are just inside
the walls to the north and south.  The Vorinden Road lies to the west.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A Kor Thrandian guard minds the gates, pike at the ready.
A Kor Thrandian guard minds the gates, pike at the ready.

<411hp 362m 108mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Beginning of Kalyius Way
  Inside the gates, a paved cobblestone street leads through the town of
Kor Thrandir.  Known as Kalyius Way, it takes its name from the famed War of
Night general.  The road itself is surprisingly clean, likely due to the
mountain wind catching the dirt and debris from both caravans and the boots
of travelers.  Stone buildings with high, sloped roofs line the street,
their heavy wooden doors keeping out the cool, fickle breeze.  What plants
are visible are mostly squat shrubs that grow stubbornly in the rocky soil. 
A sign on the building to the north marks it as the Pearl Cross.  The iron
gates are to the west, while the cobblestones continue east.  

[Exits: (north) east west]

<411hp 362m 107mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Kalyius Way
  This paved cobblestone street connects the Kor Thrandian gates to the
fortified central tower.  Kalyius Way is surprisingly clean, likely due to
the mountain wind catching the dirt and debris from both caravans and the
boots of travelers.  Stone buildings with high, sloped roofs line the
street, their heavy wooden doors keeping out the cool, fickle breeze.  What
plants are visible are mostly squat shrubs that grow stubbornly in the rocky
soil.  A sign marks the northern doorway as the Forge of the Farlight;
another marks the building to the south as the Scholar's Pen.  

[Exits: (north) east (south) west]

<411hp 362m 105mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Alliance Square
  In the center of the western portion of Kor Thrandir is Alliance Square,
named so in honor of the victorious surface forces.  A large fountain stands
in the middle of it, giving it a more indulgent look than much of the
spartan keep.  A series of wooden benches sit around the fountain, providing
citizens and travelers alike with a place to rest.  The mountain air is
clear and fresh as it blows between the town's buildings.  To the north is
the Inn of the Northern Lights, which also serves as the town bar.  Cobbled
roads lead east, south, and west.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A carved stone fountain provides a constant stream of cold water.
A Kor Thrandian patroller scans the streets for trouble.

The End of Kalyius Way
  This paved cobblestone street connects the Kor Thrandian gates to the
fortified central tower.  Kalyius Way is surprisingly clean, likely due to
the mountain wind catching the dirt and debris from both caravans and the
boots of travelers.  Stone buildings with high, sloped roofs line the

plants are visible are mostly squat shrubs that grow stubbornly in the rocky

<419hp 366m 119mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Entrance to the High Tower
  A wide, hard-packed dirt path circles the keep of Kor Thrandir,
connecting the houses and shops to the training areas, temple, and
infirmary.  The grass grows wild on the outside of the trail, smattered with
tiny white wildflowers.  The looming presence of the keep reaches skyward to
the east, its ancient stones looking dreadfully imposing.  The mountain wind
whips about the tower, sending the grasses into a sudden wave.  The path
continues north and south, while to the west, a paved road leads to the
town's shops and homes.  To the east, a large door leads into the keep
itself.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<419hp 366m 118mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gallery of Heroes
  The ceiling for the base floor of the tower extends nearly twenty feet
into the air, supported by dark stone columns.  Orbs of smokeless orange
light, high above, are mounted upon the pillars, casting their light
throughout the floor.  Set into the nearby pillar is an oil painting of
General Kalyius, leader of the Army of the Golden Hand.  A golden plaque
beneath it describes his personal heroism.  The tile floor is well-swept,
and the air is still with reverence.  Heavy wooden doors lead both to the
north and south.  The Gallery of Heroes continues to the east, while the
exit to the tower is west.  

[Exits: (north) east (south) west]

<419hp 366m 117mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gallery of Heroes
  The ceiling for the base floor of the tower extends nearly twenty feet
into the air, supported by dark stone columns.  Orbs of smokeless orange
light, high above, are mounted upon the pillars, casting their light
throughout the floor.  Set into the nearby pillar is an oil painting of
Tyril, Earendam's most famous rogue.  A golden plaque beneath each describes
his role during the War of Night.  The tile floor is well-swept, and the air
is still with reverence.  The Gallery of Heroes continues to the west, with
a large monument directly east.  

[Exits: east west]

The Monument to the Lord Protector
  At the center of the base floor of the tower is a huge bronze monument. 
Standing over ten feet tall, it depicts an enormous human warrior plunging a
sword into a fallen shuddeni's chest.  The heavy stone pillars form a ring,
encircling the monument.  Mounted orbs of smokeless orange light are placed
high upon the pillars, bathing the statue in a permanent glow.  The tile
floor is well-swept, and the air is still with reverence.  The four halls
which compose the Gallery of Heroes all lead to this monument, one to the
north, east, south, and west.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A large bronze statue of the first Lord Protector dominates the circle.

<419hp 366m 115mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gallery of Heroes
  The ceiling for the base floor of the tower extends nearly twenty feet
into the air, supported by dark stone columns.  Orbs of smokeless orange
light, high above, are mounted upon the pillars, casting their light
throughout the floor.  Set into the nearby pillar is an oil painting of the
renowned healer, Iliraya.  A golden plaque beneath it describes her role
during the War of Night.  The tile floor is well-swept, and the air is still
with reverence.  The Gallery of Heroes continues to the south, with a large
monument directly north.  

[Exits: north south]

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gallery of Heroes
  The ceiling for the base floor of the tower extends nearly twenty feet
into the air, supported by dark stone columns.  Orbs of smokeless orange
light, high above, are mounted upon the pillars, casting their light
throughout the floor.  Set into the nearby pillar is an oil painting of
Rakinal, the kankoran chieftain during the War of Night.  A golden plaque
beneath it describes his contribution to the war effort.  The tile floor is
well-swept, and the air is still with reverence.  Heavy wooden doors lead
both to the east and west.  The Gallery of Heroes continues to the north,
while the exit to the tower is south.  

[Exits: north (east) south (west)]

<419hp 366m 113mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Entrance to the High Tower
  A wide, hard-packed dirt path circles the keep of Kor Thrandir,
connecting the houses and shops to the training areas, temple, and
infirmary.  The grass grows wild on the outside of the trail, smattered with
tiny white wildflowers.  The looming presence of the keep reaches skyward to
the north, its ancient stones looking dreadfully imposing.  The mountain
wind whips about the tower, sending the grasses into a sudden wave.  The
path continues east and west, while to the south, another path branches off
to the practice fields and schools.  To the north, a large door leads into
the keep itself.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A Kor Thrandian patroller scans the streets for trouble.
A Kor Thrandian patroller leaves south.

<419hp 366m 112mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Southern Path
  Large, wooden barricades line the southern path, ensuring that the
training areas for the Kor Thrandian soldiers and archers remain both
contained and undisturbed.  The sounds of whistling arrows, clashing of
wooden weapons, and grunting of exertion are common but muted.  The path
itself is packed hard from countless generations of soldiers, archers,
swordsmen, and scholars, with only the few stubborn weeds that spring up at
its edges.  In the distance to the south, two large buildings are visible
beyond the barricades.  To the north, the keep of Kor Thrandir dominates the
skyline.  

[Exits: north south]
A Kor Thrandian patroller scans the streets for trouble.
A human child chases after a ball.

<419hp 366m 105mv> An Entrance to the High Tower
  A wide, hard-packed dirt path circles the keep of Kor Thrandir,
connecting the houses and shops to the training areas, temple, and
infirmary.  The grass grows wild on the outside of the trail, smattered with

[Exits: north east south west]

w
<419hp 366m 104mv> 
The End of Kalyius Way
  This paved cobblestone street connects the Kor Thrandian gates to the
fortified central tower.  Kalyius Way is surprisingly clean, likely due to
the mountain wind catching the dirt and debris from both caravans and the
boots of travelers.  Stone buildings with high, sloped roofs line the
street, their heavy wooden doors keeping out the cool, fickle breeze.  What
plants are visible are mostly squat shrubs that grow stubbornly in the rocky
soil.  To the north is the local bank branch, the Soldier's Wallet.  To the
east, the cobbled road gives way to a path of hard-packed dirt.  The massive
keep of Kor Thrandir towers high above.  

[Exits: north east west]

<419hp 366m 102mv> 
The Gallery of Heroes
  The ceiling for the base floor of the tower extends nearly twenty feet
into the air, supported by dark stone columns.  Orbs of smokeless orange
light, high above, are mounted upon the pillars, casting their light
throughout the floor.  Set into the nearby pillar is an oil painting of
General Kalyius, leader of the Army of the Golden Hand.  A golden plaque
beneath it describes his personal heroism.  The tile floor is well-swept,
and the air is still with reverence.  Heavy wooden doors lead both to the
north and south.  The Gallery of Heroes continues to the east, while the
exit to the tower is west.  

[Exits: (north) east (south) west]

<422hp 366m 119mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Armor Gallery
  This portion of the base floor is walled off from the Gallery of Heroes,
and houses many of the famous pieces of armor from the heroes of the War of
Night.  The high stone walls are mounted with globes of light, which forever
light the interior of the chamber.  Low platforms are placed throughout it,
with the various artifacts placed upon them.  A barrier of pulsing blue
light covers each, shielding the armor from the effects of time, or simple
thievery.  A silver plaque is affixed to the base of each platform,
describing what it holds.  The chamber continues north and east, while a
door to the west leads out.  

[Exits: north east west]
     A pair of worn leather boots, stained and cracked, lay behind the barrier.

<422hp 366m 112mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Southern Path
  The barricades which line the southern path open up here, allowing
entrance to the training grounds of Kor Thrandir.  Grunts of exertion, as
well as the clack of practice weapons and the snap of bowstrings, form a low
din which persists at nearly all hours.  The scents of practice, as well as
those of the trampled grasses and mountain wind, mix alternatingly with the
passing of the breeze.  To the west, young Thrandian soldiers practice their
martial skills, while to the east is the archery range.  The path continues
south into a cobbled courtyard, and north toward the keep.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<422hp 366m 111mv>

East  - Too dark to tell
South - Too dark to tell
West  - Too dark to tell

<422hp 366m 111mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gate to the Archery Range
  The gate to the archery range sits open, propped in that position by a
large rock.  The heavily-tread path to the west gives way to wild grasses,
which are trampled low by the passage of Kor Thrandir's archers.  There are
no trees within the range itself, leaving plenty of open space for target
practice and preparation.  Wooden barricades surround the field, separating
it to keep most of the arrows in.  The wind is light and surprisingly clear,
with the sounds of snapping bows and striking arrows drifting upon it.  The
field begins to the north, while the main path lies to the west.  

[Exits: north west]

<422hp 366m 109mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Gate to the Training Grounds
  An open wooden gate serves as the entrance to the training grounds of Kor
Thrandir.  The shouts of battle and the clash of wooden weapons split the
air, and the heavy scent of sweat drifts by on the mountain wind.  The
heavily-tread path to the east gives way to the wild grasses, which remain
thoroughly trampled by the near-constant passage of soldiers.  There are no
trees within the training ground, making it a thoroughly open expanse
enclosed by heavy wooden barricades.  To the north, the training grounds
begin, while to the east lies the main footpath.  

[Exits: north east]

<422hp 366m 108mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Path Through the Training Grounds
  A small footpath cuts through the trampled grass of the training grounds,
pounded into a slash of hard-packed dirt.  The shouts of battle and
instruction ring out from all directions, although the soldiers who follow
the path either have yet to begin, or already have completed, their daily
routine.  The thick scent of exertion is carried across the path by the
mountain wind, as well as the smell of the wild grass and the town to the
north.  The path continues west through the field and south out of it, while
the training grounds wait to the north.  

[Exits: north south west]

pounded into a slash of hard-packed dirt.  The shouts of battle and
instruction ring out from all directions, although the soldiers who follow
the path either have yet to begin, or already have completed, their daily
routine.  The thick scent of exertion is carried across the path by the
mountain wind, as well as the smell of the wild grass and the town to the
north.  The path continues east and west through the field, while the
training grounds wait to the north and south.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A perfectly balanced wooden sword lies here.

<254hp 321m 128mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Training Grounds
  The training grounds of Kor Thrandir are a hodgepodge of activity,
mottled grass, and hard-packed dirt.  The shouts of battle and the clash of
wooden weapons split the air, and the heavy scent of sweat drifts by on the
mountain wind.  There are no trees within the training ground, making it a
thoroughly open expanse enclosed by heavy wooden barricades.  A rise in the
southwest corner of the field provides an overview for the overseeing
officer, while pairs of soldiers spar on the grassy turf below it.  To the
east, south, and west, the training grounds continue.  

[Exits: east south west]
A Kor Thrandian soldier practices a drive with her weapon.
A Kor Thrandian soldier lunges forward as she trains.

A Path Through the Training Grounds
  A small footpath cuts through the trampled grass of the training grounds,
pounded into a slash of hard-packed dirt.  The shouts of battle and
instruction ring out from all directions, although the soldiers who follow
the path either have yet to begin, or already have completed, their daily
routine.  The thick scent of exertion is carried across the path by the

north.  The path continues west through the field and south out of it, while
the training grounds wait to the north.  

[Exits: north south west]

<44hp 331m 157mv> 
s
The Gate to the Training Grounds
  An open wooden gate serves as the entrance to the training grounds of Kor
Thrandir.  The shouts of battle and the clash of wooden weapons split the
air, and the heavy scent of sweat drifts by on the mountain wind.  The
heavily-tread path to the east gives way to the wild grasses, which remain
thoroughly trampled by the near-constant passage of soldiers.  There are no
trees within the training ground, making it a thoroughly open expanse
enclosed by heavy wooden barricades.  To the north, the training grounds
begin, while to the east lies the main footpath.  

[Exits: north east]

<44hp 331m 156mv> 
e
The Southern Path
  The barricades which line the southern path open up here, allowing
entrance to the training grounds of Kor Thrandir.  Grunts of exertion, as
well as the clack of practice weapons and the snap of bowstrings, form a low
din which persists at nearly all hours.  The scents of practice, as well as
those of the trampled grasses and mountain wind, mix alternatingly with the
passing of the breeze.  To the west, young Thrandian soldiers practice their
martial skills, while to the east is the archery range.  The path continues
south into a cobbled courtyard, and north toward the keep.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<44hp 331m 155mv> 
close w
You can't do that.

<44hp 331m 155mv> 
n
The Southern Path
  Large, wooden barricades line the southern path, ensuring that the
training areas for the Kor Thrandian soldiers and archers remain both
contained and undisturbed.  The sounds of whistling arrows, clashing of
wooden weapons, and grunting of exertion are common but muted.  The path
itself is packed hard from countless generations of soldiers, archers,
swordsmen, and scholars, with only the few stubborn weeds that spring up at
its edges.  In the distance to the south, two large buildings are visible
beyond the barricades.  To the north, the keep of Kor Thrandir dominates the
skyline.  

[Exits: north south]

training areas for the Kor Thrandian soldiers and archers remain both

swordsmen, and scholars, with only the few stubborn weeds that spring up at
its edges.  In the distance to the south, two large buildings are visible
beyond the barricades.  To the north, the keep of Kor Thrandir dominates the

e
<44hp 331m 151mv> 
The Gate to the Archery Range
  The gate to the archery range sits open, propped in that position by a
large rock.  The heavily-tread path to the west gives way to wild grasses,
which are trampled low by the passage of Kor Thrandir's archers.  There are
no trees within the range itself, leaving plenty of open space for target
practice and preparation.  Wooden barricades surround the field, separating
it to keep most of the arrows in.  The wind is light and surprisingly clear,
with the sounds of snapping bows and striking arrows drifting upon it.  The
field begins to the north, while the main path lies to the west.  

[Exits: north west]

<57hp 356m 172mv>

<57hp 356m 172mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Path Through the Archery Fields
  A thin dirt path crosses the archery range, passing between the southern
short-range and northern long-range targets.  The earth along the path is
packed hard, worn by the steps of generations of the keep's defenders.  The
snap of bowstrings and the swish of arrows are audible in most directions,
giving the uneasy notion of being shot at.  The sweet mountain wind blows
across the path, sweeping up trampled grass or scattering hovering gnats. 
The path continues east through the archery range, and south to the entry
gate.  

[Exits: north east south]

<57hp 356m 171mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Archery Fields
  The open fields of the archery range stretch out quite far, the high
peaks of the Brintors rising overhead in the distance.  The wild grass of
the mountains has been trampled down by the steady, repetitive visits of the
Kor Thrandian archers.  The wind here is awash with the sweet scents of
thinner air, although carrying with it a heady whiff of sweat.  Against the
far northern barricade, a variety of standing, humanoid targets are stuck
with arrows.  To the south is a path through the archery field, while the
field itself continues to the east.  

[Exits: east south]
A Kor Thrandian archer pauses to wipe his brow, taking a deep breath.
A Kor Thrandian archer pauses to wipe her brow, taking a deep breath.

field itself continues to the east and west.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Archery Fields
  The open fields of the archery range stretch out quite far, the high
peaks of the Brintors rising overhead in the distance.  The wild grass of
the mountains has been trampled down by the steady, repetitive visits of the
Kor Thrandian archers.  The wind here is awash with the sweet scents of
thinner air, although carrying with it a heady whiff of sweat.  Against the
far northern barricade, a variety of standing, humanoid targets are stuck
with arrows.  To the south is the archer overseer's post, while the field
itself continues to the west.  

[Exits: south west]
A Kor Thrandian archer fires at one of the targets.
A Kor Thrandian archer tests the string of her bow.

The Archer Captain's Post
  On the far side of the archery range is a small post for the overseeing
captain.  The ground here slopes upward as it proceeds east, giving an
improved view of the northern and southern fields.  The grass here is longer
and less trodden than elsewhere on the field, springing up through the rocky
soil.  Several stocks of arrows and additional bows lay in a cleared area,
supplying the nearby archers with whatever they might need.  The air here is
especially sweet, rolling down off of the high, looming mountains.  To the
north and south are the archery fields, while a dirt path leads west.

<91hp 366m 211mv> 
l 2.
Raiali Iristi is one of Kor Thrandir's newest officers, and oversees the
archery range.  She is short and mischievous, with wild silver hair and
rich, golden skin.  A native of the keep, she traveled abroad to study
archery and magic with Earendam's Company of the Zephyr.  She returned with
the completion of her formal training, enlisting within the military during
the Eyeblight War.  Her exceptional skill with the bow allowed her to rise
quickly within the hierarchy of the Lord Protector's archers, becoming one
of the keep's few female captains.  
Captain Raiali is in excellent condition.

Captain Raiali is using:
<worn on torso> a forged iron breastplate
<wielded>       a sleek steel sword
<held>          a smooth white longbow
